Except as provided in ea003767, floor openings shall be provided with a cover at floor level that is capable of resisting the loads specified in ep001022.3 for the adjacent area of floor.
Openings through the cover required by es014520 shall be of a size that prevents the passage of a spherical object whose diameter is more than 100 mm.

Except as provided in es014524, a guard not less than 1 070 mm high shall be provided around floor openings, where provision of a cover in accordance with es014520 is not practical, and at locations where the difference in elevation between two adjacent surfaces is more than 600 mm.

The guard required by es014522 shall consist of a top railing, an intermediate rail located at the mid-height of the guard, and where tools or other objects could fall from an upper floor surface onto a person on an adjacent lower surface, a toe board extending not less than 125 mm above the upper floor surface.
es014522 does not apply to vehicle repair pits, to loading docks, or where access is provided for maintenance purposes only.
Warning signs shall be installed in accordance with Subsection 2.14.2. of Division B of the nrcc-nfc.

A glass or transparent door shall be designed and constructed so that the existence and position of the door is readily apparent, by attaching visually contrasting hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures to it.
Transparent doors and panels shall conform to Sentences es005990, es000889and es005991.

Transparent panels used in a door that provides access to exit that, because of their physical configuration or design, could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be made inaccessible by barriers or railings.
Exit facilities complying with this Subsection shall be provided from every floor area containing a Group G, Division 1, 2 or 3 major occupancy. (See en001457.)

An exit from any floor area shall be one of the following: an exterior doorway conforming to Sentences es014538 and es014539 and Articles ea003776, ea003777 and ea000519, an openable window or panel conforming to es014540, or an exit facility listed in ea000486 that conforms to Articles ea000487, ea000488and ea000518, Sentence es007729 and ep001023.4.4
Except as provided by Sentences es014532 and es014533, every floor area shall be served by at least 2 exits.

A floor area classified as a Group G, Division 1 major occupancy is permitted to be served by a single exit, provided the floor area is not more than 10 m2, where the floor area is not sprinklered throughout, or 20 m2, where the floor area is sprinklered throughout.

A floor area classified as a Group G, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy is permitted to be served by a single exit, provided the floor area is not more than 200 m2, where the floor area is not sprinklered throughout, or 300 m2, where the floor area is sprinklered throughout.
The minimum distance between 2 exits from a floor area shall be one half the maximum diagonal dimension of the floor area.

Except as permitted by es014536, the travel distance to at least one exit shall be not more than 30 m, in a floor area that contains a Group G, Division 1 major occupancy, other than one housing livestock with a below-floor storage area for liquid manure, 60 m, in a floor area that contains a Group G, Division 1 major occupancy housing livestock with a below-floor storage area for liquid manure, 60 m, in a floor area that contains a Group G, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy and that is not sprinklered throughout, and 90 m, in a floor area that contains a Group G, Division 2 or 3 major occupancy and that is sprinklered throughout.

A floor area containing a Group G, Division 3 major occupancy need not comply with es014535, provided exits are placed not more than 60 m apart along the perimeter of the floor area, and each main aisle in the floor area leads directly to an exit in at least two opposite directions, and has a minimum width of 750 mm.
Exits shall be located and arranged in conformance with es001054.
The minimum clear width of an exterior doorway used as an exit shall be 750 mm.
Except as provided in es014540, the minimum headroom clearance in every exit shall conform to ea004783
An openable window or panel used as an exit shall have an opening not less than 900 mm by 550 mm, and a fire escape or stair, where required by ea003778
Except as permitted by es014542, every exit door shall open in the direction of exit travel, and swing on its vertical axis.
Exit doors that serve a Group G, Division 2 major occupancy housing animals need not conform to es014541a.

Door release hardware on exit doors shall be operable with one hand, permit the door to be readily opened from the inside with not more than one releasing operation and without requiring keys, special devices or specialized knowledge of the door-opening mechanism, and be installed not more than 1 200 mm above the finished floor.
Where an exterior doorway used as an exit is more than 300 mm above adjacent ground level, a stair or fire escape shall be provided.
Where the bottom of an openable window or panel used as an exit is more than 2 500 mm above adjacent ground level, a stair or fire escape shall be provided.
Fire escapes required by Sentences es014544 and es014545 shall conform to Articles ea000529and ea000531to ea000534
Exit stairs shall conform to es001096aand Articles ea004536to ea004538and ea004539
The minimum width of exit stairs shall be 900 mm.
Farm buildings shall comply with the requirements for exit signs stated in ep001023.4.5

Except as provided in Sentences es014551 to es014553, the storage, handling and use of hazardous substances shall be in conformance with provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, or in the absence of the regulations or bylaws referred to in es014550a, the nrcc-nfc. (See en001115.)
Farm buildings or parts of farm buildings used for the storage, handling, use and processing of dangerous goods shall comply with Articles ea005021to ea005027
The production, handling, storage and utilization of biogas shall be in conformance with csab149.6.

Where Article 3.2.9.1. of Division B of the nrcc-nfc applies due to the quantity and nature of the stored product, farm buildings used for the storage of ammonium nitrate shall be classified as Group G, Division 2 major occupancies, and comply with Sentences es007366to es007370.

Systems for the ventilation of cooking equipment that is used in processes producing grease-laden vapours shall be designed and installed in conformance with Articles ea000035, ea004653and ea000011 (See en000088.)

Except as provided in es014557, an exhaust ventilation system designed in conformance with the appropriate requirements of ep001022.4 shall be provided in a farm building or part of a farm building in which dust, fumes, gases, vapours or other impurities or contaminants have the potential to create a fire or explosion hazard.
Except as provided in es014557, farm buildings shall comply with es000895.
Farm buildings housing livestock with a below-floor storage area for liquid manure need not comply with Sentences es014555 and es014556, provided they comply with ea003782 (See en001459.)

National Article Title: Below-Floor Storage Areas for Liquid Manure
National Sentence Text: Farm buildings housing livestock with a below-floor storage area for liquid manure shall be provided with a ventilation system conforming to ep001022.4.2

National Article Title: Below-Floor Storage Areas for Liquid Manure
National Sentence Text: Where the ventilation system required by es014558 relies on electrical power for normal operation, it shall be provided with an emergency power supply conforming to es014560.

National Article Title: Below-Floor Storage Areas for Liquid Manure
National Sentence Text: The emergency power supply required by es014559 shall be supplied from a generator, batteries or a combination thereof, equipped with audible and visible trouble indicators, capable of operating the trouble indicators for not less than 24 h, capable of operating the ventilation system under full load for not less than 2 h, and designed so that, in the event of a failure of the normal power source to the farm building, there is an immediate automatic transfer to emergency power.

National Article Title: Below-Floor Storage Areas for Liquid Manure
National Sentence Text: Where a fuel-fired engine or turbine for the emergency power supply required by es014559 is dependent on a fuel supply located outside the farm building, the fuel supply shall be provided with a shut-off valve in conformance with ea000411

National Article Title: Below-Floor Storage Areas for Liquid Manure
National Sentence Text: Where exhaust piping for the emergency power supply required by es014559 penetrates a required fire separation, the piping shall be enclosed in a service space that is separated from the remainder of the farm building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that of the penetrated fire separation, but not less than 45 min.
Except as provided in es014564, welding and cutting operations shall be carried out in a room conforming to es007712. (See en001461.)
es014563 need not apply to agricultural occupancies where the welding and cutting operations do not present a fire or explosion hazard to adjacent areas.

National Article Title: Liquid Manure Storage Tanks and Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: This Article does not apply to below-floor storage areas for liquid manure.

National Article Title: Liquid Manure Storage Tanks and Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Access covers for liquid manure storage tanks shall be designed in accordance with ep001022.3 to support the imposed loads.

National Article Title: Liquid Manure Storage Tanks and Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Access covers for liquid manure storage tanks that weigh less than 20 kg shall be equipped with locking devices.

National Article Title: Liquid Manure Storage Tanks and Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Ladders shall not be installed on closed liquid manure storage tanks.

National Article Title: Liquid Manure Storage Tanks and Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Liquid manure storage tanks without a cover that are located outdoors shall be surrounded by a permanent safety fence or wall that extends not less than 1.5 m above adjacent ground level, is adequately secured at ground level, and has gates with latches.

National Article Title: Liquid Manure Storage Tanks and Piping Systems
National Sentence Text: Where an access point for filling, agitation, emptying or a similar operation is provided for a liquid manure storage tank described in es014569, a curb or barrier shall be installed between the access point and the storage tank that is not less than 450 mm high, or of sufficient height to prevent unintended vehicle entry.

Except as permitted by es014572, where storage tanks for liquids capable of releasing hazardous gases or vapours are connected to a farm building by a piping system, a gas trap or valve shall be installed in the piping system to prevent such gases or vapours from entering the farm building.

Where storage tanks for liquid manure are connected to a farm building by a piping system, a pull plug is permitted to be installed in the piping system to prevent hazardous gases and vapours from entering the farm building.
The storage of dangerous goods in packages or containers in farm buildings or parts of farm buildings shall comply with Parts 3 and 4 of Division B of the nrcc-nfc.
In addition to the requirements of ea003786, pesticide storage areas in farm buildings shall be designed in conformance with this Article.

Pesticide storage areas shall be ventilated with outdoor air in accordance with ep001022.4.2 by dedicated natural or mechanical means at a rate sufficient to prevent the accumulation of dangerous goods classified as toxic or flammable gases, accessible only from the outdoors, and secured against unauthorized entry.

Floors of pesticide storage areas shall be constructed of concrete or other impervious material, not have a floor drain, and be provided with a curb at the perimeter of the storage area that is designed to contain accidental spillage of the largest container in the storage area, and not less than 50 mm high.

Pesticide storage areas shall be separated from food, feed and water supplies, other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and other buildings by a limiting distance not less than 6 m.
Except as otherwise provided in this Section, the structural design of farm buildings shall conform to Part 4. (See en001463.)
Except as provided in es014580, farm buildings shall be classified in the Low Importance Category as described in et001026
Liquid manure storage tanks shall be classified in the Normal Importance Category as described in et001026
In lieu of the requirements of ea000659, a subsurface investigation of the farm building site is permitted to be carried out by a suitably qualified person prior to or during construction.

National Article Title: Loads Supported on a Floor or Suspended from a Ceiling
National Sentence Text: In addition to the requirements of ea004586, the specified live load supported on a floor or suspended from a ceiling shall be not less than the applicable value listed in et000481

Areas designed for the accumulation of poultry manure, such as solid floors and dropping pits under a wire floor, slotted floor or cage, shall be designed for a specified live load of not less than 1 kPa for each 100 mm depth of manure.

Where machinery or vehicles not exceeding 1 000 kg in gross weight are used for manure clean-out in a poultry barn, the barn floor shall be designed for a specified two-wheel live load of not less than 6 kN in addition to the specified live load prescribed in es014583.
Floors supporting stored products shall be designed for the specified live load due to their intended use and occupancy, but not for less than 5 kPa. (See en001464.)

The specified uniformly distributed live load on an area of floor used for farm machinery or vehicles shall be for farm machinery and vehicles not exceeding 4 000 kg in gross weight, not less than 2.4 kPa, for farm machinery and vehicles exceeding 4 000 kg but not exceeding 9 000 kg in gross weight, not less than 6 kPa, and for farm machinery and vehicles exceeding 9 000 kg in gross weight, not less than 12 kPa.
The specified live load due to possible concentrations of load resulting from the use of an area of floor for farm machinery or vehicles shall comply with ea000636

Where an area of floor is used for processing or for loading or unloading of vehicles, the minimum specified live loads prescribed in Sentences es014586 and es014587 shall be increased by 50% for the area.
Tops of liquid manure storage tanks that are accessible to vehicular traffic or used as a floor in a farm building shall be designed for the loads due to their intended use and occupancy.

Tops of liquid manure storage tanks that are located outdoors but not exposed to vehicular traffic shall be designed for the dead load plus the snow and rain loads prescribed in ep001024.1.6 or for the dead load plus 2 kPa, whichever produces the most critical effect.

Walls and partitions of liquid manure storage tanks shall be designed for an internal lateral pressure based on an equivalent fluid density of 10 kN/m3 for liquid manure, and the anticipated internal lateral ice pressure. (See en001465.)

Vertical external walls of liquid manure storage tanks located below ground level shall be designed for the anticipated lateral earth pressure, which shall not be used to reduce the effects of the internal lateral pressures specified in es014591 (see en001466), and a lateral surcharge load of 5 kPa, applied uniformly below ground level, where earth within 1.5 m of the walls is subject to vehicular loads.
Concrete used for liquid manure storage tanks shall conform to the appropriate exposure class of csaa23.1.

Liquid manure storage tank walls, bases and appurtenances, including piping for the conveyance of liquid manure and associated connections and joints, shall be designed and constructed to minimize leakage of liquid manure. (See en001467.)

For unobstructed slippery roofs of farm buildings with a roof slope, α, greater than 15° but not greater than 60° from the horizontal, where snow and ice can slide completely off the roof, the slope factor, Cs shall be calculated as follows:Cs=60°-a53°(See en001468.)

In a farm building classified as a Group G, Division 3 major occupancy where heating and drainage systems are installed to prevent the accumulation of snow and water, the supporting structure for the light-transmitting roof areas is permitted to be designed for a specified roof snow load of not less than 1 kPa, provided the heating system is capable of maintaining a minimum interior temperature of 10°C throughout the farm building, and an emergency power supply is provided that is supplied from a power source such as batteries, a generator, or a combination thereof, and will continue to supply power to the heating system in the event that the regular power supply to the farm building is interrupted.

Farm buildings need not be designed for loads due to earthquakes in accordance with ep001024.1.8 where the Seismic Category is SC1, or the Seismic Category is SC2, and the RdRo value of the seismic force resisting system (SFRS) is equal to or greater than 3.0 (see en001470).
For the purpose of es014597, the Seismic Category is permitted to be determined on the basis of IES(0.2) alone.
For the purpose of Sentences es014597 and es014598, the Seismic Category is permitted to be determined by assigning Site Class D without carrying out a subsurface investigation.

Except as provided in es013652, and except as otherwise provided in this Section, systems and equipment for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning services in farm buildings shall conform to Part 6.
Farm buildings need not comply with Articles ea004651 and ea000793 and Sentences es007693 and es008044.

Except as provided in es013654, the rates at which outdoor air is supplied in farm buildings by ventilation systems shall be in accordance with good engineering practice as described in ea004646 (See en001146.)
Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, farm buildings containing a Group G, Division 4 major occupancy need not comply with es013653.

Except as provided in es013656, where a fuel-fired appliance is installed in a farm building containing a Group G, Division 3 major occupancy, separate combustion air and flue systems shall be provided.
es013655 need not apply where the fuel-fired appliance is specifically designed as a generator of carbon dioxide for enrichment of the atmosphere in the farm building, and conforms to csab149.1.
This Article applies to controlled-atmosphere storage areas that, during storage periods, contain an atmosphere with an oxygen content less than 19.5% or more than 23% by volume.
During storage periods, controlled-atmosphere storage areas need not comply with es013653.

Prior to a controlled-atmosphere storage area being accessed after a storage period and while the storage area is accessible between storage periods, the ventilation system of the storage area shall supply outdoor air to the storage area at a rate in accordance with es013653, and ensure that the atmosphere in the storage area has an oxygen content not less than 19.5% and not more than 23% by volume.
A warning sign shall be provided at each entrance to a controlled-atmosphere storage area in accordance with Sentence 2.14.2.1.(5) of Division B of the nrcc-nfc.

Where an enclosed tower silo, horizontal silo, or grain storage bin is connected to an adjacent feed room, mechanical exhaust ventilation shall be provided to remove air from the lowest floor level of the feed room to the outdoors at a rate not less than 3 air changes per hour.

The ventilation system of the farm building in which the feed room referred to in es013661 is located shall be designed to prevent airflow from the feed room to any other part of the floor area of the farm building.

Enclosed horizontal silos shall be ventilated by openings at roof or eave level with an area not less than 1% of the floor area of the silo that consist of a continuous ridge opening, openings in both gable ends, or openings in the eaves on each side of the roof, and openings at floor level with an area not less than 1% of the floor area of the silo (see en001193). (See en001175.)

Farm buildings housing livestock with below-floor storage of liquid manure shall be provided with a ventilation system that supplies outdoor air at a rate that is sufficient to limit the concentrations of dangerous goods classified as flammable gases to not more than 25% of their lower explosive limit, sufficient to limit the concentrations of dangerous goods classified as toxic gases to those permitted in the applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in the ACGIH's acgih-iv-mrp, and not less than 2 air changes per hour. (See en001198.)
Fuel-fired heating appliances shall be located and separated from the remainder of the farm building in conformance with ea003730

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in es007221b, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in et000491 (See en001281.)
The scope of this Part shall be as described in ep001032.3.3.
Words that appear in italics are defined in ea004484.

For the purposes of this Part, the term “storage tank” shall mean a vessel for flammable liquids or combustible liquids having a capacity of more than 230 L and designed to be installed in a fixed location.
Information to be submitted regarding major components of fire protection shall conform to the requirements of ep001036.2.3.

Except as permitted by Articles ea004451 to ea000154, every building or part thereof shall be classified according to its major occupancy as belonging to one of the Groups or Divisions described in et000114 (See en000019.)
A building intended for use by more than one major occupancy shall be classified according to all major occupancies for which it is used or intended to be used.

Any building is deemed to be occupied by a single major occupancy, notwithstanding its use for more than one major occupancy, provided that all occupancies are classified as belonging to the same Group classification or, where the Group is divided into Divisions, as belonging to the same Division classification described in et000114
An arena-type building intended for occasional use for trade shows and similar exhibition purposes shall be classified as a Group A, Division 3 occupancy. (See en000020.)

A police station with detention quarters is permitted to be classified as a Group B, Division 2 major occupancy provided the station is not more than 1 storey in building height and 600 m2 in building area.

Convalescent homes and children's custodial homes are permitted to be classified as residential occupancies within the application of Part 3, provided that occupants are ambulatory and live as a single housekeeping unit in a suite with sleeping accommodation for not more than 10 persons.
Buildings or parts thereof used for the storage of baled combustible fibres shall be classified as medium-hazard industrial occupancies.
Except as permitted by Sentences es000162 and es000163, major occupancies shall be separated from adjoining major occupancies by fire separations having fire-resistance ratings conforming to et000115

In a building not more than 3 storeys in building height, if not more than two dwelling units are contained together with a Group E major occupancy, the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation between the two major occupancies need not be more than 1 h.

In a building conforming to the requirements of Articles ea004508 to ea000422, the requirements of es000161 for fire separations between major occupancies do not apply at the vertical plane around the perimeter of an opening through the horizontal fire separation.
No major occupancy of Group F, Division 1 shall be contained within a building with any occupancy classified as Group A, B or C.
Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.
A building permitted to be of combustible construction is permitted to be constructed of combustible materials, with or without noncombustible components. (See en000860.)
The flame-spread rating on any exposed surface of foamed plastic insulation, and on any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the insulation in any direction, shall be not more than 500.

Except as permitted in es005918, foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly in combustible construction shall be protected from adjacent spaces in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, and wall and ceiling assemblies, by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections ep001029.29.4 to ep001029.29.9, provided the building does not contain a Group A, Group B or Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, not less than 0.38 mm thick, and with a melting point not below 650°C, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of es005930 (see en000021). (See en000862.)

A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted in a building required to be of combustible construction, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in ep001023.1.12, have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the space in which they are located or the space that they bound, as applicable. (See en000863.)
The flame-spread rating of doors containing foamed plastics shall comply with Sentences es000345 to es000347.

Except as required by es016097, optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are installed in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall not convey flame or continue to burn for more than 1 min when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT1 rating) in csac22.2no.0.3 or be located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see en000023), masonry walls, concrete slabs, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to es000229b. (See en000022.) (See also es001241.)

Except as permitted in Sentences es005920 and es016098, optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are installed in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall exhibit the following characteristics when tested in conformance with ulcs102.4 (FT6 rating): a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5.

Except as permitted in es016098, where totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are used in a plenum, exposed components of wiring systems with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, including optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data, that are installed in the plenum or that extend not more than 9 m from the plenum, including drop down to the floor level, are permitted, provided they exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 rating) in csac22.2no.0.3.
Cables or wires within plenums that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm systems need not comply with the requirements of es016097.
Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building permitted to be of combustible construction shall meet the requirements of es000229a.

If fire-retardant-treated wood is specified in this Part, the wood shall be pressure impregnated with fire-retardant chemicals in conformance with csao80series and have a flame-spread rating not more than 25.
If combustible construction is permitted and is not required to have a fire-resistance rating more than 45 min, heavy timber construction is permitted to be used.
If heavy timber construction is permitted, it shall conform to ea004454
Wood elements in heavy timber construction shall be arranged in heavy solid masses and with essentially smooth flat surfaces to avoid thin sections and sharp projections.
Except as permitted by Sentences es007604 to es000178 and es007605, the minimum dimensions of wood elements in heavy timber construction shall conform to et000116

Where splice plates are used at splices of roof arches supported on the tops of walls or abutments, roof trusses, roof beams and roof girders in heavy timber construction, they shall be not less than 64 mm thick.

Floors in heavy timber construction shall be of glued-laminated or solid sawn plank not less than 64 mm thick, splined or tongued and grooved, or 38 mm wide and 89 mm deep set on edge and well spiked together.

Floors in heavy timber construction shall be laid so that no continuous line of end joints will occur except at points of support, and covered with tongued and grooved flooring not less than 19 mm thick laid crosswise or diagonally, or tongued and grooved phenolic-bonded plywood, strandboard or waferboard not less than 12.5 mm thick, and not closer than 15 mm to the walls to provide for expansion, with the gap covered at the top or bottom.

Roofs in heavy timber construction shall be of tongued and grooved phenolic-bonded plywood, strandboard or waferboard not less than 28 mm thick, or glued-laminated or solid sawn plank that is not less than 38 mm thick, splined or tongued and grooved, or not less than 38 mm wide and 64 mm deep set on edge and laid so that no continuous line of end joints will occur except at the points of support.
Wood columns in heavy timber construction shall be continuous or superimposed throughout all storeys.

Superimposed wood columns in heavy timber construction shall be connected by reinforced concrete or metal caps with brackets, steel or iron caps with pintles and base plates, or timber splice plates fastened to the columns by metal connectors housed within the contact faces.
Where beams and girders in heavy timber construction enter masonry, wall plates, boxes of the self-releasing type or hangers shall be used.
Wood girders and beams in heavy timber construction shall be closely fitted to columns, and adjoining ends shall be connected by ties or caps to transfer horizontal loads across the joints.
In heavy timber construction, intermediate wood beams used to support a floor shall be supported on top of the girders or on metal hangers into which the ends of the beams are closely fitted.

Roof arches supported on the top of walls or abutments, roof trusses, roof beams and roof girders in heavy timber construction are permitted to be not less than 64 mm wide provided where two or more spaced members are used, the intervening spaces are blocked solidly throughout, or tightly closed by a continuous wood cover plate not less than 38 mm thick secured to the underside of the members, or the underneath of the roof deck or sheathing is sprinklered.

Except as provided in es008948, not less than 90% of the exterior cladding on each exterior wall of buildings conforming to ea000030 or ea000031 shall consist of noncombustible cladding, or except as provided in es013875, a wall assembly that satisfies the criteria of es000195b. (See en000864.) (See also Notes en000027 and en000028.)

Where a building is considered to face 1 street in accordance with es005961b, the exterior cladding on each exterior wall of buildings conforming to ea000030 or ea000031 shall consist of noncombustible cladding, or except as provided in es013875, a wall assembly that satisfies the criteria of es000195b.

A wall assembly conforming to es005921b or es008948b that includes combustible cladding made of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to the accelerated weathering test specified in astmd2898.
Exterior wall assemblies constructed in accordance with ex000109.7 of Appendix D are deemed to comply with Clauses es005921band es008948b.

Except as permitted by Sentences es007607 to es007609 and Articles ea004458 to ea004462, ea000234 and ea000266, a building or part of a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall be constructed with noncombustible materials. (See also ep001023.1.13 for the requirements regarding the flame-spread rating of interior finishes.)

Notwithstanding the definition of noncombustible materials stated in ea004484, a material is permitted to be used in noncombustible construction provided that, when tested in accordance with ulcs135 at a heat flux of 50 kW/m2, its average total heat release is not more than 3 MJ/m2, its average total smoke extinction area is not more than 1.0 m2, and the test duration is extended beyond the time stipulated in the referenced standard until it is clear that there is no further release of heat or smoke.

If a material referred to in es007607 consists of a number of discrete layers and testing reveals that the surface layer or layers protect the underlying layers such that complete combustion of the underlying layers does not occur, the test shall be repeated by removing the outer layers sequentially until all layers have been exposed during testing, or until complete combustion has occurred.

The acceptance criteria for a material tested in accordance with es007608 shall be based on the cumulative emissions from all layers, which must not exceed the criteria stated in Clauses es007607a and es007607b.

The following minor combustible components are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction: paint (see also es000344b), self-adhesive tapes, mastics and caulking materials, including foamed plastic air sealants, applied to provide a seal between the major components of exterior wall construction, (see also ea000560 for limits on the use of combustible materials in plenum spaces), firestops and fire blocks conforming to es007621 and ea004473, tubing for pneumatic controls provided it has an outside diameter of not more than 10 mm, adhesives, vapour barriers and sheathing papers, electrical outlet and junction boxes, wood blocking intended for the attachment of window elements within exterior wall assemblies, wood blocking within wall assemblies intended for the attachment of handrails, fixtures, and similar items mounted on the surface of the wall, and similar minor components.
Combustible roof covering that has an A, B, or C classification determined in conformance with ep001023.1.15 is permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Combustible roof sheathing and roof sheathing supports installed above a concrete deck are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concrete deck is not less than 50 mm thick, the height of the roof space above the deck is not more than 1 m, the roof space is divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with ea004472, openings through the concrete deck other than for noncombustible roof drains and plumbing piping are protected by masonry or concrete shafts constructed as fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, and extending from the concrete deck to not less than 150 mm above the adjacent roof sheathing, the perimeter of the roof is protected by a noncombustible parapet extending from the concrete deck to not less than 150 mm above the adjacent sheathing, and except as permitted by es000187d, the roof space does not contain any building services.
Combustible cant strips, roof curbs, nailing strips and similar components used in the installation of roofing are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Wood nailer facings to parapets that are not more than 610 mm high are permitted on a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the facings and any roof membranes covering the facings are protected by sheet metal.

Combustible skylight assemblies are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction if the assemblies have a flame-spread rating not more than 150 provided the assemblies have an individual area not more than 9 m2, have an aggregate horizontal projected area of the openings through the ceiling not more than 25% of the area of the ceiling of the room or space in which they are located, and are spaced not less than 2.5 m from adjacent assemblies and from required fire separations, or 75 provided the assemblies have an individual area not more than 27 m2, have an aggregate horizontal projected area of the openings through the ceiling not more than 33% of the area of the ceiling of the room or space in which they are located, and are spaced not less than 1.2 m from adjacent assemblies and from required fire separations. (See en000025.)
Combustible vertical glazing installed no higher than the second storey is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
Except as permitted by es000193, the combustible vertical glazing permitted by es000191 shall have a flame-spread rating not more than 75.

The flame-spread rating of combustible glazing is permitted to be not more than 150 if the aggregate area of glazing is not more than 25% of the wall area of the storey in which it is located, and the glazing is installed in a building not more than 1 storey in building height, the glazing in the first storey is separated from the glazing in the second storey in accordance with the requirements of ea000349 for opening protection, or the building is sprinklered throughout.
Combustible window sashes and frames are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided they are vertically non-contiguous between storeys.

Except as provided in Sentences es016384 and es000198, combustible cladding is permitted to be used on an exterior wall assembly in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or sprinklered throughout, and except as provided in es013876, when tested in accordance with ulcs134, the wall assembly satisfies the following criteria for testing and conditions of acceptance (see en000026): flaming on or in the wall assembly does not spread more than 5 m above the opening (see en000027), and the heat flux during the flame exposure on the wall assembly is not more than 35 kW/m2 measured at 3.5 m above the opening (see en000028).

Except as permitted by Articles ea000342 and ea000343, where the limiting distance in Tables et000137 to et000140 permits an area of unprotected openings of not more than 10% of the exposing building face, the construction requirements of et001204 shall be met.

A wall assembly permitted by es000195 that includes combustible cladding of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to an accelerated weathering test as specified in astmd2898.
Exterior wall assemblies constructed in accordance with ex000109.7 of Appendix D are deemed to comply with es000195b.

Combustible components, other than those permitted by ea004459 and es005925, are permitted to be used in an exterior wall assembly of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, or sprinklered throughout, and the wall assembly except as provided in es013877, satisfies the criteria of es000195b, or is protected by masonry or concrete cladding not less than 25 mm thick (see en000026).
Exterior wall assemblies constructed in accordance with ex000109.7 of Appendix D are deemed to comply with es005923b1.

Except as provided in es005925, factory-assembled wall and ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group A, Group B, or Group C major occupancy, and the panels do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ulcs138 meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in ep001023.1.12, have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.

Factory-assembled exterior wall panels containing thermosetting foamed plastic insulation are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is not more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, and does not contain a Group B or Group C major occupancy, and the wall panels do not contain an air space, are protected on both sides by sheet steel not less than 0.38 mm thick, remain in place for not less than 10 min when tested in conformance with ulcs101 where the exposed surface includes typical vertical and horizontal joints, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in ep001023.1.12, have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the room or space that they bound.

A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 is permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered, and the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick with a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, when tested in accordance with ulcs138 meet the criteria defined therein, and when a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation is subjected to the applicable test described in ep001023.1.12, have a flame-spread rating not more than that permitted for the space in which they are located or the space that they bound, as applicable. (See en000863.)

Wood nailing elements attached directly to or set into a continuous noncombustible backing for the attachment of interior finishes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed space created by the wood elements is not more than 50 mm thick.

Combustible millwork, including interior trim, doors and door frames, show windows together with their frames, aprons and backing, handrails, shelves, cabinets and counters, is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
Combustible stage flooring supported on noncombustible structural members is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Wood members more than 50 mm but not more than 300 mm high applied directly to or set into a noncombustible floor slab are permitted for the construction of a raised platform in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the concealed spaces created are divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with es000330.
The floor system for the raised platform referred to in es000203 is permitted to include a combustible subfloor and combustible finished flooring.
Combustible finished flooring is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.
Combustible stairs are permitted in a dwelling unit in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Except as permitted in Sentences es000208 and es000209, combustible interior wall and ceiling finishes referred to in es000344b that are not more than 1 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Combustible interior wall finishes, other than foamed plastics, that are not more than 25 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 150 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction.

Except as provided in es005927, combustible interior ceiling finishes, other than foamed plastics, that are not more than 25 mm thick are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 25 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that not more than 10% of the ceiling area within each fire compartment is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150.

Combustible interior ceiling finishes made of fire-retardant-treated wood are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided they are not more than 25 mm thick or are exposed fire-retardant-treated wood battens.

Gypsum board with a tightly adhering paper covering not more than 1 mm thick is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the flame-spread rating on the surface is not more than 25.
Foamed plastic insulation shall conform to ea000025

Combustible insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 25 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Combustible insulation is permitted to be installed above roof decks, outside of foundation walls below ground level, and beneath concrete slabs-on-ground of buildings required to be of noncombustible construction.

Except as provided in Sentences es000212 and es000213, combustible insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry, or concrete.

Combustible insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the exterior walls of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in thebuilding, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry or concrete not less than 25 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ulcs101 will not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 10 min (see en000029) (see also ea004480).

Combustible insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the interior walls, within ceilings and within roof assemblies of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of Type X gypsum board not less than 15.9 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, conforming to astmc1177m astmc1178m astmc1396m astmc1658m or csaa82.27 non-loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 50 mm thick, loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 75 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ulcs101 does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 20 min, and remains in place for not less than 40 min.

Foamed plastic insulation is permitted to be installed above roof decks, outside of foundation walls below ground level, and beneath concrete slabs-on-ground of a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Except as provided in Sentences es005931, es005932and es005924, foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry, concrete, or any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of classification B when tested in conformance with ulcs124.

Foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the exterior walls of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of gypsum board not less than 12.7 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, lath and plaster, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation, masonry or concrete not less than 25 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ulcs101 does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 10 min (see en000029) (see also ea004480).

Foamed plastic insulation with a flame-spread rating more than 25 but not more than 500 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is permitted in the interior walls, within ceilings and within roof assemblies of a building required to be of noncombustible construction that is not sprinklered and is more than 18 m high, measured from grade to the underside of the roof, provided the insulation is protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within wall assemblies, by a thermal barrier consisting of Type X gypsum board not less than 15.9 mm thick, mechanically fastened to a supporting assembly independent of the insulation and with all joints either backed or taped and filled, conforming to astmc1177m astmc1178m astmc1396m or csaa82.27 non-loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 50 mm thick, loadbearing masonry or concrete not less than 75 mm thick, or any thermal barrier that, when tested in conformance with ulcs101 does not develop an average temperature rise more than 140°C or a maximum temperature rise more than 180°C at any point on its unexposed face within 20 min, and remains in place for not less than 40 min.

Except as permitted by es000217, solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and wood framing in partitions located in a fire compartment not more than 600 m2 in area are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction in a floor area that is not sprinklered throughout provided the partitions are not required fire separations, and are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy.

Partitions installed in a building of noncombustible construction are permitted to contain wood framing provided the building is not more than 3 storeys in building height, the partitions are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, and the partitions are not installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces.

Solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and partitions that contain wood framing are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided the building is sprinklered throughout, and the partitions are not located in a care, treatment or detention occupancy, installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces, or used to satisfy the requirements of Clause es000803a.
Storage lockers in storage rooms are permitted to be constructed of wood in a building of residential occupancy required to be of noncombustible construction.

Except as required by Sentence es001241, combustible ducts, including plenums and duct connectors, are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided these ducts and duct connectors are used only in horizontal runs.

Combustible duct linings, duct coverings, duct insulation, vibration isolation connectors, duct tape, pipe insulation and pipe coverings are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they conform to the appropriate requirements of ep001023.6.5

In a building required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible ducts need not comply with the requirements of Sentences es001246 and es001247 provided the ducts are part of a duct system conveying only ventilation air, and contained entirely within a dwelling unit.

Except as permitted by es007610e and Sentences es000224 and es000225, combustible piping and tubing and associated adhesives are permitted to be used in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided that, except when concealed in a wall or concrete floor slab, they have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, and if used in a building described in ep001023.2.6, have a smoke developed classification not more than 50.
Combustible sprinkler piping is permitted to be used within a sprinklered floor area in a building required to be of noncombustible construction. (See also ea004502)

Polypropylene pipes and fittings are permitted to be used for drain, waste and vent piping for the conveyance of highly corrosive materials and for piping used to distribute distilled or dialyzed water in laboratory and hospital facilities in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the building is sprinklered throughout, the piping is not located in a vertical shaft, and piping that penetrates a fire separation is sealed at the penetration by a firestop that has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation when subjected to the fire test method in ulcs115 with a pressure differential of 50 Pa between the exposed and unexposed sides, with the higher pressure on the exposed side.

Combustible plumbing fixtures, including wall and ceiling enclosures that form part of the plumbing fixture, are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction provided they are constructed of material having a flame-spread rating and smoke developed classification not more than that permitted for the wall surface of the room or space in which they are installed.

Except as required by es016100 and ea000180, optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes are permitted in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 rating) in csac22.2no.0.3 the wires and cables are located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways (see en000023), masonry walls, concrete slabs, a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h, or totally enclosed non-metallic raceways conforming to es000229b, or the wires and cables are communication cables used at the service entry to a building and are not more than 3 m long. (See en000030.)

Except as permitted in Sentences es016102 and es016101, optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data and are not located in totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are permitted to be installed in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction, provided the wires and cables exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ulcs102.4 (FT6 rating).

Except as permitted in es016101, where totally enclosed noncombustible raceways are used in a plenum, exposed components of wiring systems with combustible insulation, jackets or sheathes, including optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables that are used for the transmission of voice, sound or data, that are installed in the plenum or that extend not more than 9 m from the plenum including drop down to the floor level, are permitted provided they exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test – Cables in Cable Trays (FT4 rating) in csac22.2no.0.3.
Cables or wires within plenums that are used for the transmission of signals in fire alarm systems need not comply with the requirements of Sentences es016100 and es016102.
Combustible travelling cables are permitted on elevating devices in a building required to be of noncombustible construction.

Except as required in es016103, subject to the limits on the size of elements that penetrate fire separations when complying with ea000212, within a fire compartment of a building required to be of noncombustible construction, totally enclosed non-metallic raceways not more than 175 mm in outside diameter, or of an equivalent rectangular area, are permitted to be used to enclose optical fibre cables and electrical wires and cables, provided where the wires and cables in the raceways meet or exceed the requirements of es000227a, the non-metallic raceways meet the requirements for at least an FT4 rating in csac22.2no.262 or ulcs143 and where the wires and cables in the raceways do not meet or exceed the requirements of es000227a, the non-metallic raceways exhibit a vertical char of not more than 1.5 m when tested in conformance with the Vertical Flame Test (FT4) – Conduit or Tubing on Cable Tray in Clause 6.16 of csac22.2no.211.0.

Totally enclosed non-metallic raceways used in a plenum in a building required to be of noncombustible construction shall exhibit a horizontal flame distance of not more than 1.5 m, an average optical smoke density of not more than 0.15, and a peak optical smoke density of not more than 0.5 when tested in conformance with ulcs102.4 (FT6 rating).

On buildings required to be of noncombustible construction, decorative wood cladding is permitted to be used on the exterior fascias and soffits of marquees or canopies on the building face of a storey having direct access to a street or access route, provided the wood cladding is fire-retardant-treated wood that has been conditioned in conformance with astmd2898, before being tested in accordance with ulcs102.
Encapsulated mass timber construction permitted in this Part shall conform to this Subsection.
Except as otherwise provided in this Part and es001768, materials used in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction shall conform to ep001023.1.5

Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection and Articles ea000266 and ea000351, a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction is permitted to include structural mass timber elements, including beams, columns, arches, and wall, floor and roof assemblies, provided they comply with Sentences es013835 and es013836.

Structural mass timber elements referred to in es013834 shall except as provided in es013837, be arranged in heavy solid masses containing no concealed spaces, have essentially smooth flat surfaces with no thin sections or sharp projections, and except as provided in es013872, conform to the minimum dimensions stated in et000470

Adhesives used in structural mass timber elements referred to in es013834 that are constructed of cross‐laminated timber shall conform to the elevated temperature performance requirements in apaprg320.

Concealed spaces are permitted within structural mass timber elements referred to in es013835 and need not conform to es013838, provided the concealed spaces are sprinklered and divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with ep001023.1.11, completely filled with rock or slag fibre insulation conforming to ulcs702, and having a density not less than 32 kg/m3, if horizontal, lined with not less than a single layer of 12.7 mm thick Type X gypsum board or noncombustible material providing an encapsulation rating of not less than 25 min, or if vertical, lined with not less than a single layer of 12.7 mm thick Type X gypsum board or noncombustible material providing an encapsulation rating of not less than 25 min and vertically divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with ep001023.1.11

Except as provided in Sentences es013840 to es013843, es013837, es013871 and es013873, and Articles ea003704 and ea003709, the exposed surfaces of structural mass timber elements conforming to ea003702 shall be protected from adjacent spaces in the building, including adjacent concealed spaces within wall, floor and roof assemblies, by a material or assembly of materials conforming to es013839 that provides an encapsulation rating of not less than 50 min. (See en001433.)

Except as provided in es013858, the material or assembly of materials referred to in es013838 shall consist of gypsum board, gypsum concrete, noncombustible materials, materials that conform to Sentences es007607to es007609, or any combination of the materials listed in Clauses es013839a to es013839d.

Except as provided in es013842, the exposed surfaces of mass timber beams, columns and arches within a suite or fire compartment need not be protected in accordance with es013838, provided their aggregate surface area does not exceed 10% of the total wall area of the perimeter of the suite or fire compartment in which they are located, and the flame-spread rating on any exposed surface is not more than 150. (See en001434.)

Except as provided in Sentences es013842 and es013843, the exposed surfaces of mass timber walls within a suite need not be protected in accordance with es013838, provided each exposed surface faces the same direction, and the flame-spread rating on any exposed surface is not more than 150. (See Notes en001435 and en001434.)

The aggregate exposed surface area of mass timber elements within a suite permitted in Sentences es013840 and es013841 shall not exceed 35% of the total wall area of the perimeter of the suite. (See en001434.)

The exposed surfaces of mass timber ceilings within a suite need not be protected in accordance with es013838, provided their aggregate area does not exceed 10% of the total ceiling area of the suite, where the exposed surfaces have a flame-spread rating not more than 150, or 25% of the total ceiling area of the suite, where the suite contains no mass timber walls with exposed surfaces, and the exposed surfaces of the mass timber ceiling have a flame-spread rating not more than 75. (See en001434.)

Except as provided in ea003558, the rating of a material or assembly of materials that is required to have an encapsulation rating shall be determined on the basis of the results of tests conducted in conformance with ulcs146.
Gypsum‐concrete topping and concrete not less than 38 mm thick are deemed to have an encapsulation rating of 50 min when installed on the upper side of a mass timber floor or roof assembly.

Two layers of Type X gypsum board each not less than 12.7 mm thick are deemed to have an encapsulation rating of 50 min when installed on a mass timber element, provided they are fastened with a minimum of two rows of screws in each layer directly to the mass timber element with screws of sufficient length to penetrate not less than 20 mm into the mass timber element that are spaced not more than 400 mm o.c. and 20 mm to 38 mm from the boards' edges, or to wood furring or resilient metal or steel furring channels not more than 25 mm thick spaced not more than 400 mm o.c. on the mass timber element, are installed with the joints in each layer staggered from those in the adjacent layer, are installed in conformance with astmc840, except that their joints need not be taped and finished, and conform to astmc1396m, or csaa82.27. (See en000990.)

Wood roof sheathing and roof sheathing supports that do not conform to Articles ea003702 and ea003703 are permitted in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided they are installed above a concrete deck in accordance with es000187, or above a deck of encapsulated mass timber construction, where said deck is permitted to be encapsulated between the roof sheathing supports by a material or assembly of materials conforming to es013839 that provides an encapsulation rating of not less than 50 min, the height of the roof space is not more than 1 m, the roof space is divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with ea004472, openings through the deck other than for noncombustible roof drains and plumbing piping are protected by shafts constructed as fire separations having a fire-resistance rating not less than 1 h that extend from the deck to not less than 150 mm above the adjacent sheathing, and except as permitted by es013844b4, the roof space does not contain any building services.

Combustible cant strips, roof curbs, nailing strips and similar components used in the installation of roofing are permitted on a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction.

Wood nailer facings to parapets that are not more than 610 mm high are permitted on a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided the facings and any roof membranes covering the facings are protected by sheet metal.

Combustible window sashes and frames are permitted in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided each window in an exterior wall face is an individual unit separated from every other opening in the wall by noncombustible wall construction or mass timber wall construction conforming to the dimensions stated in et000470, windows in exterior walls in contiguous storeys are separated by not less than 1 m of noncombustible wall construction or mass timber wall construction conforming to the dimensions stated in et000470, and the aggregate area of openings in an exterior wall face of a fire compartment is not more than 40% of the area of the wall face.

Except as provided in Sentences es013849, es013850 and es013853, cladding on an exterior wall assembly of a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction shall be noncombustible. (See en001436.)

Except as provided in Sentences es013850 to es013852, cladding on an exterior wall assembly of a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction is permitted to consist of combustible cladding that is not contiguous over more than 4 storeys, represents not more than 10% of the cladding on each exterior wall of each storey, is not more than 1.2 m in width, has a flame-spread rating not more than 75 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, is separated from other portions of combustible cladding on adjacent storeys by a horizontal distance of not less than 2.4 m, and is separated from other portions of combustible cladding by a horizontal distance of not less than 1.2 m, combustible cladding that is not contiguous across adjacent storeys, represents not more than 10% of the cladding on each exterior wall of each storey, has a flame-spread rating not more than 75 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, and is separated from other portions of combustible cladding on adjacent storeys by a horizontal distance of not less than 2.4 m, combustible cladding representing up to 100% of the cladding on exterior walls of the first storey, provided all portions of the cladding can be directly accessed and are located not more than 15 m from a street or access route conforming to ea000381, measured horizontally from the face of the building, except as provided in es013851, a wall assembly that satisfies the criteria of es000195b, or a combination of noncombustible cladding and the cladding described in Clauses es013849a to es013849d. (See en001436.)

The permitted area of combustible cladding in es013849a or es013849b shall not exceed 5% of the cladding on each exterior wall of each storey where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the arrival of the first fire department vehicle at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all fire department calls to the building. (See en001537.)
An exterior wall assembly constructed in conformance with ex000109.7 of Appendix D is deemed to satisfy the criteria of es013849d.

Except as provided in ea000342, where the limiting distance in et000139 or et000140 permits an area of unprotected openings of not more than 10% of the exposing building face, the construction requirements of et001204 shall be met.

A wall assembly conforming to es013849d that includes combustible cladding made of fire-retardant-treated wood shall be tested for fire exposure after the cladding has been subjected to the accelerated weathering test specified in astmd2898.

Where combustible cladding conforming to es013849a or es013849b on an exterior wall of a fire compartment is exposed to combustible cladding conforming to es013849a or es013849b on an exterior wall of the same fire compartment or of another fire compartment, and the planes of the two walls are parallel or at an angle less than 135° measured from the exterior of the building, the different portions of combustible cladding shall be separated by a horizontal distance of not less than 3 m, and not be contiguous over more than 2 storeys.

Except as provided in es013856, combustible components, other than those permitted by ea003706, are permitted to be used in an exterior wall assembly of a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided the wall assembly meets the requirements of es013849d.
An exterior wall assembly constructed in conformance with ex000109.7 of Appendix D is deemed to satisfy the criteria of es013855.
Non-loadbearing wood elements permitted in ea000023 need not conform to ea003702 in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction.

Wood nailing elements are permitted to be used for the attachment of a material or assembly of materials used to provide an encapsulation rating in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided the concealed space created by the wood nailing elements is not more than 25 mm deep.

Except as permitted by es013871 and ea003558, wood nailing elements are permitted to be used for the attachment of interior finishes in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided the concealed space created by the wood nailing elements is not more than 50 mm deep and exposed surfaces in the concealed space have a flame-spread rating not more than 25, or the concealed space is filled with noncombustible insulation.

Wood members that are more than 50 mm but not more than 300 mm high are permitted to be used for the construction of a raised platform in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, and they need not conform to Articles ea003702 and ea003703, provided the concealed spaces created by the wood members are divided into compartments by fire blocks in conformance with es013669, and the wood members are applied directly to or set into a noncombustible floor slab, or applied directly to a mass timber floor assembly that conforms to the requirements of ea003702

The upper surface of the mass timber floor assembly referred to in es013860b2 is permitted to be encapsulated only between the wood members by a material or assembly of materials conforming to Sentences es013838and es013839.
The floor system for the raised platform referred to in es013860 is permitted to include a combustible subfloor and combustible finished flooring.

Wood stairs and landings conforming to the requirements for floor assemblies in ea003702 and Sentences es013838and es013839 are permitted in an exit stairwell in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction.
Wood stairs in a suite in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction need not conform to Articles ea003702and ea003703

Except as provided in Sentences es013866and es013867, combustible interior wall and ceiling finishes referred to in es000344b that are not more than 1 mm thick are permitted in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction.

Except as provided in Sentences es013840and es013841, combustible interior wall finishes, other than foamed plastics, that are not more than 25 mm thick are permitted in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 150 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction.

Except as provided in Sentences es013868and es013840and es013843, combustible interior ceiling finishes, other than foamed plastics, that are not more than 25 mm thick are permitted in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided they have a flame-spread rating not more than 25 on any exposed surface, or any surface that would be exposed by cutting through the material in any direction, except that not more than 10% of the ceiling area within each fire compartment is permitted to have a flame-spread rating not more than 150. (See en001213.)

Combustible interior ceiling finishes made of fire-retardant-treated wood are permitted in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided they are not more than 25 mm thick or are exposed fire-retardant-treated wood battens.

Solid lumber partitions not less than 38 mm thick and partitions containing wood framing that do not conform to ea003702 are permitted in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction, provided the partitions are protected on each face with not less than a single layer of 12.7 mm thick Type X gypsum board, with all joints either backed or taped and filled, conforming to astmc1396m, or csaa82.27, a single layer of 19 mm thick fire-retardant-treated wood, on solid lumber partitions, or a single layer of 19 mm thick fire-retardant-treated wood, on partitions containing wood framing, where the wood stud cavities are filled with noncombustible insulation, and not installed as enclosures for exits or vertical service spaces.

National Article Title: Exposed Construction Materials and Components in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es013871 and ea004473, and except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, only construction materials and components permitted in noncombustible construction shall be permitted to have exposed surfaces in concealed spaces within floor, roof, and wall assemblies in a building or part of a building permitted to be of encapsulated mass timber construction.

National Article Title: Exposed Construction Materials and Components in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Exposed surfaces are permitted in a concealed space created by the attachment of a material or assembly of materials conforming to es013838, provided the concealed space is not more than 25 mm deep.

The minimum dimensions stated in et000470 need not apply at cutouts in vertical or horizontal structural mass timber elements where outlet boxes are installed in accordance with ea000028 (See also en001092.)
The exposed surfaces of the cutouts described in es013872 need not be protected in accordance with es013838.
Outlet boxes on opposite sides of a structural mass timber element having a fire-resistance rating shall be separated by a distance of not less than 600 mm.

Except as permitted by es000242 and Articles ea000189 and ea000035, the rating of a material, assembly of materials or a structural member that is required to have a fire-resistance rating, shall be determined on the basis of the results of tests conducted in conformance with ulcs101.
A material, assembly of materials or a structural member is permitted to be assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of Appendix ex000109.

The limit on the rise of temperature on the unexposed surface of an assembly as required by the tests referred to in Sentence es000241 shall not apply to an exterior wall that has a limiting distance of 1.2 m or more, provided correction is made for radiation from the unexposed surface in accordance with Sentence es000562.
Floor, roof and ceiling assemblies shall be rated for exposure to fire on the underside.
Firewalls and interior vertical fire separations shall be rated for exposure to fire on each side.
