The STC ratings of separating assemblies shall be determined in accordance with astme413 using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with astme90.

The ASTC ratings of separating assemblies and adjoining constructions shall be determined in accordance with astme413 using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with astme336 or calculated in accordance with the detailed method described in ea000076, or the simplified method described in ea000077

Compliance with the required STC ratings shall be demonstrated through measurements carried out in accordance with es001003, or the construction of separating assemblies conforming to those presented in et000261 or et000456, as applicable.

Compliance with the required ASTC ratings shall be demonstrated through measurements or calculations carried out in accordance with es008810, or the construction of separating assemblies conforming to those presented in et000261 or et000456, as applicable, that have an STC rating of not less than 50 in conjunction with flanking assemblies constructed in accordance with ea001885
The sound transmission loss measured in accordance with astme90 shall be used in lieu of the sound reduction index required in iso15712-1.

The vibration reduction index for the junctions between separating assemblies shall be determined using the equations presented in Annex E of iso15712-1, or measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of iso10848-1.
The normalized flanking level difference shall be measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of iso10848-1.

The direct sound reduction index for the separating assembly in situ shall be determined using es008816a or es008816b, depending on the type of construction: for a separating wall or floor assembly with lightweight wood or steel framing, the index shall be taken as equal to the sound transmission loss, without correction; for a separating wall or floor assembly that behaves like a homogeneous panel, the index shall be determined in accordance with the detailed method for structure-borne transmission presented in iso15712-1 (see en001483).

The flanking sound reduction index for each flanking path at each edge of the separating assembly shall be determined using es008817a, es008817b or es008817c, depending on the type of construction: for a separating wall or floor assembly with lightweight wood or steel framing and connected flanking assemblies with lightweight wood or steel framing, the index shall be taken as equal to the normalized flanking level difference re-normalized for the ASTC field situation in accordance with Annex F of iso15712-1, for a separating wall or floor assembly that behaves like a homogeneous panel and connected flanking assemblies that behave like a homogeneous panel, the index shall be determined in accordance with the detailed method for structure-borne transmission presented in iso15712-1 (see en001483), for a mixture of assemblies with lightweight wood or steel framing and assemblies that behave like a homogeneous panel, the index shall be determined in accordance with es008817a or es008817b (see en001483).

Once the pertinent indices and measurements referred to in Sentences es008813 to es008817 have been determined based on the type of construction, the apparent sound reduction index shall then be determined in accordance with iso15712-1.

The ASTC shall be calculated in accordance with astme413 using the apparent sound reduction index determined in es008818, which shall be treated as equivalent to the values of apparent sound transmission loss measured in accordance with astme336.
The STC rating shall be used in lieu of the weighted sound reduction index required in iso15712-1.

The vibration reduction index for the junctions between separating assemblies shall be determined using the equations presented in Annex E of iso15712-1, or measured in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of iso10848-1.
The weighted normalized flanking level difference shall be determined in accordance with astme413 using the results from measurements carried out in accordance with Parts 1 to 4 of iso10848-1.
The direct weighted sound reduction index for the separating assembly shall be taken as equal to the STC, without correction.

The weighted flanking sound reduction index for each flanking path at each edge of the separating assembly shall be determined using es008824a or es008824b, depending on the type of construction: for a separating wall or floor assembly with lightweight wood or steel framing and connected flanking assemblies with lightweight wood or steel framing, the index shall be taken as equal to the weighted normalized flanking level difference re-normalized for the ASTC field situation in accordance with Annex F of iso15712-1; for a separating wall or floor assembly that behaves like a homogeneous panel and connected flanking assemblies that behave like a homogeneous panel, the index shall be determined in accordance with the simplified method for structure-borne transmission presented in iso15712-1 (see en001483).

Once the pertinent indices and measurements referred to in Sentences es008820 to es008824 have been determined based on the type of construction, the ASTC shall then be calculated in accordance with iso15712-1.

Except as provided in es007990 and elsewhere in this Part, materials and components, and their installation, shall conform to the requirements of the applicable standards in et001042 where those materials or components are incorporated into environmental separators or assemblies exposed to the exterior, and installed to fulfill the requirements of this Part. (See en001182.)
The requirements for flame-spread ratings contained in thermal insulation standards shall be applied only as required in Part 3.
This Subsection applies to windows, doors and skylights, including their components, that separate interior space from exterior space, or environmentally dissimilar interior spaces.
For the purpose of this Subsection, the term “skylight” refers to unit skylights, roof windows and tubular daylighting devices.
Where a wired glass assembly is installed in a required fire separation, it need not conform to the requirements of this Subsection. (See en001183.)
Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the requirements in csa101a440 (Harmonized Standard), and csaa440S1.

Performance grades for windows, doors and skylights shall be selected according to the Canadian Supplement referenced in es016160b so as to be appropriate for the conditions and geographic location in which the window, door or skylight will be installed.
Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the performance grades selected in es016161 when tested in accordance with the Harmonized Standard referenced in es016160a.

National Article Title: Structural and Environmental Loads, Air Leakage and Water Penetration
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors, skylights and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with ea004627, ep001025.4 and ep001025.6, where they are not covered in the scope of the standards listed in es016160, or ea005039, where they are covered in the scope of the standards listed in es016160. (See en000925.)
Windows, doors and skylights shall meet the heat transfer performance requirements stated in ep001025.3 (See en000222)

Except as provided in es001608, all metal-framed glazed assemblies separating interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.
Metal-framed glazed assemblies need not comply with es001607 where these assemblies are storm windows or doors, or windows or doors that are required to have a fire-protection rating. (See en000224.)
For the purpose of this Subsection, the term “other fenestration assemblies” refers to curtain walls, window walls, storefronts and glazed architectural structures. (See en000927.)
Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with ea004627 (See en000928.)
Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall meet the heat transfer performance requirements stated in ep001025.3 (See en000929.)

Other fenestration assemblies using metal framing that separate interior conditioned space from interior unconditioned space or exterior space shall incorporate a thermal break to minimize condensation.
Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with ep001025.4

Except as provided in es008832, other fenestration assemblies and their components shall have an air leakage characteristic, measured at an air pressure difference of 75 Pa, when tested in accordance with astme283 that is not greater than 0.2 L/(s×m2) for fixed portions, including any opaque portions, and 1.5 L/(s×m2) for operable portions. (See en000930.)

The following systems need not comply with es008831: interior windows and interior doors that do not serve as environmental separators, vehicular access doors (garage doors), storm windows and storm doors, commercial entrance systems, revolving doors, smoke and relief air vents, site-built door systems, and commercial steel doors. (See en000931.)
Other fenestration assemblies and their components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with ep001025.6

Except as provided in es008836, other fenestration assemblies and their components not covered in ea005039 shall resist water penetration when tested in accordance with astme331 or astme547. (See en000932.)
Tests referred to in es008834 shall be carried out at the driving rain wind pressure as calculated in accordance with csaa440S1. (See en000933.)

The following systems need not comply with es008834: interior windows and interior doors, vehicular access doors (garage doors), storm windows and storm doors, commercial entrance systems, revolving doors, smoke and relief air vents, site-built door systems, and commercial steel doors. (See en000934.)

National Article Title: Structural Loads, Heat Transfer, Air Leakage, Vapour Diffusion and Water Penetration
National Sentence Text: Exterior insulation finish systems and their components shall comply with ep001025.1.4 and Sections ep001025.3 to ep001025.6, and ulcs716.1 where covered in the scope of that standard. (See en000935.)

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in es007221b, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in et001101 (See en001281.)
The scope of this Part shall be as described in ep001032.3.3.
This Part applies to systems and equipment for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning services.
Words that appear in italics are defined in ea004484.
Plans, specifications and other information for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall conform to ep001036.2.6.

Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, shall be designed, constructed and installed in conformance with good engineering practice such as that described in, but not limited to, the ASHRAE Handbooks and Standards, the hraisar-g1 the Hydronics Institute Manuals, the NFPA Standards, the SMACNA Manuals, the ACGIH manual entitled acgih-iv-mrp csab214 csaz317.2 epa625_r92-016, and ashrae12.
The outdoor conditions to be used in designing heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be determined in conformance with Subsection ep001021.1.3

Except as provided in es016049, the outdoor air quality conditions of the geographic area of the building site to be used in designing ventilation systems shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, shall be equal to or less than the maximum acceptable levels stated in the Canada-wide Standards for Particulate Matter (PM) and Ozone as follows: a 24 hour average of 30 µg/m3 for particulate matter that is 2.5 µm or less in diameter (PM2.5), and an 8 hour average of 65 ppb for ground-level ozone. (See en001550.)

The outdoor air quality conditions of the local area of the building site to be used in designing ventilation systems shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the requirements of es008841. (See en000936.)

Heating and cooling systems shall be designed to allow for expansion and contraction of the heat transfer fluid and to maintain the system pressure within the rated working pressure limits of all components of the system.
Mechanical systems and equipment shall be designed and installed to accommodate the maximum relative structural movement provided for in the construction of the building.

Except as provided in Articles ea000756 and ea000757, the installation of heating and air-conditioning equipment, including mechanical refrigeration equipment, and including provisions for mounting, clearances and air supply, shall conform to appropriate provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, to the requirements of csab51 csab52 csab139 csab149.1 csab365 or csac22.1.

Equipment requiring periodic maintenance and forming part of a heating, ventilating or air-conditioning system shall be installed with provision for access for inspection, maintenance, repair and cleaning. (See en000241.)
Mechanical equipment shall be provided with guards so as to prevent injury.
Heating, ventilating or air-conditioning systems shall be protected from freezing if they may be adversely affected by freezing temperatures.
Asbestos shall not be used in HVAC systems and equipment.
The design, construction, installation and alteration of every indoor incinerator shall conform to nfpa82.
A storage bin for solid fuel shall not be located above a sewer opening or drain opening.
Storage bins for solid fuel shall be designed and constructed so that the air temperature in the bin or the surface temperature of any part of the floor or walls is below 50°C.
Except as provided in es001685, all buildings shall be ventilated in accordance with this Section.

Except in storage garages covered by ea004651, outdoor air shall be supplied to buildings for ventilation purposes in accordance with one of the following Sections of ashrae62.1, as a minimum: Section 6.2, Ventilation Rate Procedure, excluding the exception stated in Section 6.2.7.1.2 and note H of Table 6.2.2.1, Section 6.3, Indoor Air Quality Procedure, or Section 6.4, Natural Ventilation Procedure, excluding residential occupancies.
Except in storage garages covered by ea004651, exhaust ventilation shall be provided in accordance with Section 6.5, Exhaust Ventilation, of ashrae62.1, as a minimum.
Self-contained heating-season mechanical ventilation systems serving only one dwelling unit shall comply with ep001029.32.3

National Article Title: Crawl Spaces and Attic or Roof Spaces
National Sentence Text: Unconditioned and unoccupied crawl spaces and attic or roof spaces shall be ventilated by natural or mechanical means as required by Part 5. (See en001197.)

Except as provided in Sentences es001690 and es001692, an enclosed storage garage for five or more motor vehicles shall have a mechanical ventilation system designed to limit the concentration of carbon monoxide to not more than 100 parts per million parts of air, limit the concentration of nitrogen dioxide to not more than 3 parts per million parts of air, where the majority of the vehicles stored are powered by diesel-fuelled engines, or provide, during operating hours, a continuous supply of outdoor air at a rate of not less than 3.9 L/s for each square metre of floor area (see ea000441). (See en000937.) (See also es001015.)

Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with es008026a shall be controlled by carbon monoxide monitoring devices, and systems provided in accordance with es008026b shall be controlled by nitrogen dioxide or other acceptable monitoring devices. (See en001195.)

Mechanical ventilation systems provided in accordance with es008026 shall be designed such that the pressure in the storage garage is less than the pressure in adjoining buildings of other occupancy, or in adjacent portions of the same building having a different occupancy.
In storage garages subject to the requirements of Sentences es008026 and es008027, where motor vehicles are parked by mechanical means, the ventilation requirements may be reduced by one half.
Except as provided in es001692, ticket and attendant booths of storage garages shall be pressurized with a supply of uncontaminated air.
The requirements of Sentences es008026 to es001691 shall not apply to open-air storeys in a storage garage.
Heat recovery ventilators with rated capacities of not less than 25 L/s and not more than 200 L/s shall be installed in accordance with Subsection ep001029.32.3

Air contaminants of concern within buildings shall be removed insofar as is possible at their points of origin, and not be permitted to accumulate in concentrations greater than those permitted by applicable provincial or territorial requirements or, in the absence of such requirements, by good engineering practice such as that described in the publications listed in es008019, measured using the methodology described therein.

Systems serving spaces that contain sources of contamination and systems serving other occupied parts of the building but located in or running through spaces that contain sources of contamination shall be designed in such a manner as to prevent the spread of such contamination to other occupied parts of the building.
Heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be designed to minimize the growth and spread of bio-contaminants.
Except as provided in ea000035, systems for the ventilation of commercial cooking equipment shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to nfpa96.

This Subsection applies to the design, construction and installation of air duct distribution systems serving heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems other than those in dwelling units covered by Part 9.

HVAC systems that generate condensate or introduce liquid water into the airstream in the ducts shall be equipped with drain pans that are designed in accordance with Section 5.10, Drain Pans, of ashrae62.1 provided with an outlet that is piped to the outside of the airstream in a location where condensate can be safely disposed of, installed so that water does not stagnate and drains from the pan, and designed and installed so as to be accessible for cleaning and maintenance.
Drain pans and associated piping shall be constructed of corrosion-resistant, non-porous materials that do not promote the proliferation of disease-causing micro-organisms.
All ducts, duct connectors, associated fittings and plenums used in air duct systems shall be constructed of materials as described in ea000564
Ducts that are used in a location where they may be subjected to excessive moisture shall have no appreciable loss of strength when wet and shall be resistant to moisture-induced corrosion.
All ductwork and fittings shall be constructed and installed as recommended in SMACNA Manuals and ASHRAE Standards.

All duct materials shall be suitable for exposure to the temperature and humidity of the air being carried and shall be resistant to corrosion caused by contaminants in the air being conveyed in the duct.
Air duct systems shall have tight-fitting connections throughout.
Coverings, linings and associated adhesives and insulation used in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with ea000567
Duct linings shall be installed so that they will not interfere with the operation of volume or balancing dampers or of fire dampers, fire stop flaps and other closures.
The clearance of ducts and plenums from combustible materials shall comply with ea000569
In a care or residential occupancy, air from one suite shall not be circulated to any other suite or to a public corridor.
Except as permitted by Sentences es008048 and es008041, air duct systems serving storage garages shall not be directly interconnected with other parts of the building.

Exhaust ducts referred to in es001715 are permitted to exhaust through an enclosed storage garage prior to exhausting to the outdoors, provided the storage garage's exhaust system runs continuously, the capacity of the storage garage's exhaust system is equal to or exceeds the volume of the exhaust entering the garage, and a leakage rate 1 smoke/fire damper rated in accordance with ulcs1121 is provided near the duct outlet location in the storage garage to prevent air from the storage garage from entering the exhaust ductwork system in the event the building's exhaust fan is shut down.

In ventilating systems that exhaust air to the outdoors, provision shall be made for the admission of a supply of makeup air in sufficient quantity so that the operation of the exhaust system and other exhaust equipment or combustion equipment is not adversely affected.
Makeup air facilities required by es001722 shall be interlocked with the exhaust devices they serve so that both operate together.

Where makeup air facilities are intended to introduce air directly from the outdoors to occupied parts of the building in winter, they shall incorporate means of tempering that air to maintain the indoor design temperature.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Supply, return and exhaust air openings located less than 2 m above the floor in rooms or spaces in buildings shall be protected by grilles having openings of a size that will not allow the passage of a 15 mm diam sphere.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Outdoor air intakes shall be located so that the quality of the air entering the building complies with Sentences es016184 and es008838, and they are separated a minimum distance from sources of contaminants in accordance with et000070

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Outdoor air intakes shall be installed not less than 0.3 m above roofs, landscape grades or other surfaces, taking into account anticipated snow accumulation levels.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Exterior openings for outdoor air intakes and exhaust outlets shall be shielded from the entry of snow and rain and shall be fitted with corrosion-resistant screens of mesh having openings not larger than 15 mm, except where experience has shown that climatic conditions require larger openings to prevent the screen openings from icing over.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Screens required in es001727 shall be accessible for maintenance.

National Article Title: Supply, Return, Intake and Exhaust Air Openings
National Sentence Text: Combustible grilles, diffusers and other devices covering supply, return, intake and exhaust openings shall comply with ea000570
Except as provided in es001709, exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving separate rooms or spaces shall not be combined.

Exhaust ducts of non-mechanical ventilating systems serving similar occupancies may be combined immediately below the point of final delivery to the outdoors, such as at the base of a roof ventilator.
Exhaust ducts of ventilating systems shall have provision for the removal of condensation where this may be a problem.
Exhaust outlets shall be designed to prevent backdraft under wind conditions.
Except as permitted in es008041, exhaust systems shall discharge directly to the outdoors. (See en000244.)

Exhaust systems are permitted to exhaust into a storage garage, provided they serve rooms that are accessible only from that storage garage, the exhaust contains no contaminants that would adversely affect the air quality in the storage garage (see en001199), and they are designed in accordance with es008048. (See en000244.)

Exhaust ducts connected to laundry-drying equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts, accessible for inspection and cleaning, and constructed of a smooth corrosion-resistant material. (See en000939.)

Where collective venting of multiple installations of laundry-drying equipment is used, the ventilation system shall be connected to a common exhaust duct that is vented by one central exhaust fan, include an interlock to activate the central exhaust fan when laundry-drying equipment is in use, and be provided with make-up air. (See en000939.)
Exhaust ducts or vents connected to laundry-drying equipment shall discharge directly to the outdoors.

Except as provided in es008043 and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing water closets, urinals, basins, showers or slop sinks shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

Except as provided in es008043 and except for self-contained systems serving individual dwelling units, exhaust ducts serving rooms containing residential cooking equipment shall be independent of other exhaust ducts.

Two or more exhaust systems described in Sentences es001715 and es001716 may be interconnected or connected with exhaust ducts serving other areas of the building, provided the connections are made at the inlet of an exhaust fan, and all interconnected systems are equipped with suitable back pressure devices to prevent the passage of odours from one system to another when the fan is not in operation, or the exhaust ducts discharge to a shaft that is served by an exhaust fan having a capacity that is equal to or greater than the combined capacity of the exhaust fans discharging to the plenum multiplied by the operation diversity factor, provided that the exhaust fan serving the shaft operates continuously (see en001200).

Where exhaust ducts containing air from conditioned spaces pass through or are adjacent to unconditioned spaces, the ducts shall be constructed to prevent condensation from forming on the inside or outside of the ducts.
Return-air systems shall comply with ea000571
Where a ceiling space is used as a return-air plenum, the requirements of ea000560 shall apply.
A public corridor or exit shall not be used as a return-air plenum.

Underground ducts shall be constructed and installed to provide interior drainage from and access to all low points, not be connected directly to a sewer, and be installed and constructed of materials recommended by ASHRAE and SMACNA Standards and HRAI Manuals.
A clean-out or pump-out connection shall be provided in an underground duct system at every low point of the duct system.
Air filters for air duct systems shall conform to the requirements for Class 2 air filter units as described in ulcs111.

When electrostatic-type filters are used, they shall be installed so as to ensure that the electric circuit is automatically de-energized when filter access doors are opened or, in dwelling units, when the furnace circulation fan is not operating.

Where outdoor air quality conditions do not meet the requirements of es016184, ventilation required by es008022 shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce particles and gases to the maximum acceptable levels described in es016184 prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

Where contaminants of concern are present in the outdoor air of the local area of the building site, ventilation required by es008022 shall be provided by a ventilation system designed to include devices that reduce the concentrations of contaminants to those permitted in the ACGIH's acgih-iv-mrp prior to the introduction of outdoor air to indoor occupied spaces.

Evaporative heat rejection systems shall incorporate a drift eliminator or other means to minimize the dispersion of entrained water droplets, and have a design discharge velocity that does not exceed the maximum discharge velocity recommended by the manufacturer.
Evaporative heat rejection systems shall be designed so that water continuously circulates through all parts of the system that are normally wetted when the system is operating.

Evaporative heat rejection systems and their components shall be constructed of corrosion-resistant, non-porous materials that do not promote the proliferation of disease-causing micro-organisms and that are compatible with disinfectants, biocides and other cleaning agents.

Evaporative heat rejection systems shall be installed such that no discharge air bypasses the drift eliminator or other means referred to in es008951a, and the systems are accessible for cleaning, inspection and maintenance.

Except as provided in es008955, air discharged from evaporative heat rejection systems shall discharge away from the building, so as to not re-enter it, to a distance not less than 2.15 m above sidewalks and driveways, 7.6 m from outdoor air intakes, 3 m horizontally or vertically from exterior doors and operable windows, and 3 m horizontally or vertically from occupiable outdoor spaces, excluding maintenance spaces. (See en000998.)
Air discharged from evaporative heat rejection systems in health care facilities shall discharge away from the building in compliance with csaz317.2. (See en000998.)
Air intakes of evaporative heat rejection systems shall incorporate protective measures to minimize the entrainment of vegetation and other organic matter.
Make-up water connections shall be equipped with backflow prevention devices that conform to Article 2.6.2.1. of Division B of the nrcc-npc. (See en000999.)

Water treatment systems and equipment for controlling the proliferation of disease-causing micro-organisms shall be provided in accordance with Section 7.6.2. of ashrae12, and include means for drainage, dilution, cleaning, and application of chemicals for the control of scale, corrosion and biological contamination. (See en000999.)
Drains, overflows and blow-downs shall be connected to the building's drainage system in accordance with Clause 2.4.2.1.(1)(e) of Division B of the nrcc-npc.
Evaporative heat rejection systems shall be provided with access openings, service platforms, fixed ladders and fall-restraint connections to allow inspection, maintenance and testing.

National Article Title: Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers and Humidifiers
National Sentence Text: Evaporative air coolers, misters, atomizers, air washers and humidifiers shall be designed in accordance with Sections 8 and 9 of ashrae12.

National Article Title: Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers and Humidifiers
National Sentence Text: Systems referred to in es007692 shall be designed so that water continuously circulates through all parts of the system that are normally wetted when the system is operating, and incorporate a method of preventing water stagnation within the system itself and the internal plumbing when the system is not operating. (See en001020.)

National Article Title: Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers and Humidifiers
National Sentence Text: All components of systems referred to in es007692, including filters and evaporation media, shall be constructed of corrosion-resistant, non-porous materials that do not promote the proliferation of disease-causing micro-organisms.

National Article Title: Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers and Humidifiers
National Sentence Text: Associated sumps shall be constructed of corrosion-resistant, non-porous materials that do not promote the proliferation of disease-causing micro-organisms, include auxiliary drains to prevent the overflow of water into ductwork, and be installed so that they can be flushed, drained, cleaned and disinfected.

National Article Title: Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers and Humidifiers
National Sentence Text: Where misters, atomizers or air washers are used in ductwork, the affected duct section shall be designed to ensure drainage of unevaporated and accumulated water, and constructed of corrosion-resistant, non-porous materials that do not promote the proliferation of disease-causing micro-organisms.

National Article Title: Evaporative Air Coolers, Misters, Atomizers, Air Washers and Humidifiers
National Sentence Text: Make-up water connections shall be equipped with backflow prevention devices that conform to Article 2.6.2.1. of Division B of the nrcc-npc. (See en001022.)

Fans for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be located and installed so that their operation does not adversely affect the draft required for proper operation of fuel-fired appliances, and does not allow the air in the duct system to be contaminated by air or gases from the boiler room or furnace room.

Fans and associated air-handling equipment, such as air washers, filters and heating and cooling units, when installed on the roof or elsewhere outside the building, shall be of a type designed for outdoor use.
Vibration isolation connectors in air duct systems shall comply with ea000565
Tape used for sealing joints in air ducts, plenums and other parts of air duct systems shall comply with ea000566

Except as provided in Articles ea000809 and ea000810, the products of combustion from oil-, gas- and solid-fuel-burning appliances shall be vented in conformance with the requirements in the applicable appliance installation standard listed in ea000755

Except as provided in ea000755, vented products of combustion, other than those referred to in es001787, shall be discharged away from the building, so as not to re-enter it, to a distance not less than 2.15 m above sidewalks and driveways, 3 m from outdoor air intakes, 3 m horizontally or vertically from doors and operable windows, and 3 m horizontally or vertically from occupiable outdoor spaces, excluding maintenance spaces. (See en000940.)
Rectangular masonry or concrete chimneys not more than 12 m in height shall conform to ep001029 if they serve appliances with a combined total rated heat output of 120 kW or less, or fireplaces.
Masonry or concrete chimneys other than those described in es001788 shall be designed and installed in conformance with the appropriate requirements in nfpa211.
Single wall metal smoke stacks shall be designed and installed in conformance with nfpa211.
Access ladders for chimneys, when provided, shall consist of steel or bronze rungs, built into the walls of the chimneys.
Rungs for external ladders shall begin at not less than 2.5 m from ground level.

This Subsection applies to laboratories where dangerous goods, including flammable liquids and combustible liquids, are used in normal laboratory operations in quantities or in a manner that creates a fire or explosion hazard.

A laboratory shall be provided with continuous mechanical ventilation designed to ensure that dangerous goods vapours and particles do not accumulate in the laboratory, are prevented from migrating to other parts of the building, do not accumulate in the ventilation system, are exhausted to the outdoors, and are not returned to the building.

A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be provided with monitoring devices to indicate that the ventilation system is in operation, and sound an alarm if the ventilation system is malfunctioning.
A ventilation system required by this Subsection shall be maintained in conformance with Article 5.5.4.1. of Division B of the nrcc-nfc.

The ventilation system for a power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the nrcc-nfc shall conform to nfpa91 provide continuous exhaust ventilation at an air velocity sufficient to prevent the accumulation of combustible or reactive deposits in the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system, confine dangerous goods vapours and particles to the area where they are generated and exhaust them to the outdoors, not return the exhausted air to the building, and be provided with well identified control switches that are located outside of the power-ventilated enclosure, and readily accessible in case of an emergency.

The power-ventilated enclosure required by Sentence 5.5.4.2.(1) of Division B of the nrcc-nfc and its exhaust duct system shall except as provided in Sentences es005181 and es005182, be constructed of noncombustible materials compatible with and chemically resistant to the dangerous goods vapours and particles being exhausted, and be provided with access doors to permit inspection and maintenance of the fan assembly and exhaust ducts.

Combustible materials are permitted in systems described in es016354a if such materials are required by the corrosive or reactive properties of the dangerous goods being used, and their flame-spread rating is not more than 25.
The flame-spread rating required by es005181 is permitted to be greater than 25 if an automatic fire suppression system is provided inside the power-ventilated enclosure and its exhaust duct system.

Except for appliances installed in dwelling units, fuel-fired heating appliances shall be located, enclosed or separated from the remainder of the building in conformance with ep001023.6 (See also ep001029.10.10)
Fuel-fired appliances installed outside a building shall be designed and constructed for outdoor use.
Every unit heater using either steam or hot water as the heating medium shall be installed such that the clearances between the appliance and adjacent combustible material conform to et000161

A noncombustible lining or backing shall be provided for every steam or hot water radiator and convector located in a recess or concealed space, or attached to the face of a wall of combustible construction or encapsulated mass timber construction.
Every steam or hot water radiator and convector shall be installed so as to conform to the clearance requirements of et000161
Insulation and coverings on pipes shall comply with ea000568
Insulation and coverings on pipes shall be composed of material that will withstand deterioration from softening, melting, mildew and mould at the operating temperature of the system.
Exposed piping or equipment subject to human contact shall be insulated so that the temperature of the exposed surface does not exceed 52°C. (See en000245.)

Where a cooling unit is combined with a fuel-fired furnace in the same duct system, the cooling unit shall be installed in parallel with the heating furnace, upstream of the furnace provided the furnace is designed for such application, or downstream of the furnace provided the cooling unit is designed to prevent excessive temperature or pressure in the refrigeration system.

Piping shall be made from materials designed to withstand the effects of temperatures and pressures that may occur in the system. (See Articles ea000177, ea004468, ea004762 and ea004763 for fire safety requirements.)
Every pipe used in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be installed to allow for expansion and contraction due to temperature changes.
Supports and anchors for piping in a heating or air-conditioning system shall be designed and installed to ensure that undue stress is not placed on the supporting structure.
Clearances between combustible material and bare pipes carrying steam or hot water shall conform to et000161
The exposed surface temperature of a steam or hot water radiator shall not exceed 70°C unless precautions are taken to prevent human contact. (See en000245.)

Where a pipe carrying steam or hot water at a temperature above 120°C passes through a combustible floor, ceiling or wall, the construction shall be protected by a sleeve of metal or other noncombustible material not less than 50 mm larger in diameter than the pipe.
Where piping for heating or air-conditioning systems is enclosed in a shaft, the requirements of ea000554 for shafts shall apply.
Service pipes passing through a storage bin for solid fuel shall be protected or so located as to avoid damage to the pipes.
Except for fuel-thawing pipes, every pipe designed to operate at a temperature of 50°C or above shall be located where solid fuel cannot be stored in contact with it.

Any covering of an access opening through which a person could enter shall be openable from the inside without the use of keys where there is a possibility of the opening being accidentally closed while the system or equipment is being serviced.
Air duct systems shall have no openings other than those required for the proper operation and maintenance of the system.
Access openings shall be provided in duct systems to allow the removal of material that may accumulate in plenums and ducts.

When odour removal equipment of the adsorption type is used, it shall be installed to allow access so that adsorption material can be reactivated or renewed, and protected from dust accumulation by air filters installed on the inlet side.
Facilities for flushing and drainage shall be provided where filters are designed to be washed in place.
The fire safety characteristics of heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall comply with Subsection ep001023.6.5

Characteristics referred to in es001669 include but are not limited to use of combustible materials in duct systems, flame-spread ratings and smoke-developed ratings of duct and pipe materials and coverings, installation of equipment relative to property lines, and requirements for fire dampers and fire stop flaps.

Except as provided in Subsection ep001026.3.4, systems serving spaces that contain hazardous gases, dusts or liquids shall be designed, constructed and installed to conform to the requirements of the applicable provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, to good engineering practice such as that described in the publications of the National Fire Protection Association and in the nrcc-nfc. (See en001196.)

When indoor piping for Class I flammable liquids is installed in a trench, the trench shall be provided with positive ventilation to the outdoors, or designed to prevent the accumulation of flammable vapours.
Fire protection systems for commercial cooking equipment referred to in es001697 using vegetable oil or animal fat shall conform to ul300 or ulcc1254.6.
Fire dampers shall conform to Article ea000201
Air handling systems shall incorporate smoke detectors where and as required by ea000365
Where an exhaust duct system is used for smoke removal in a high building, the requirements of ea000400 shall apply.
Where exhaust duct systems from more than one fire compartment are connected to an exhaust duct in a vertical service space, the requirements of ea000557 shall apply.
Where ducts penetrate fire separations separating exits from the remainder of the building, they shall be in accordance with Article ea000507

This Article applies to every building that contains a residential occupancy, a care occupancy with individual suites, or a care occupancy containing sleeping rooms not within a suite, and that also contains a fuel-burning appliance, or a storage garage.

Carbon monoxide (CO) alarms required by this Article shall conform to csa6.19 be equipped with an integral alarm that satisfies the audibility requirements of csa6.19 have no disconnect switch between the overcurrent device and the CO alarm, where the CO alarm is powered by the electrical system serving the suite (see en001273), and be mechanically fixed at a height above the floor as recommended by the manufacturer.

Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a suite of residential occupancy or in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.

Where a fuel-burning appliance is installed in a service room that is not in a suite of residential occupancy nor in a suite of care occupancy, a CO alarm shall be installed either inside each bedroom, or if outside, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways, in every suite of residential occupancy or suite of care occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with the service room, and in the service room.

For each suite of residential occupancy or suite of care occupancy that shares a wall or floor/ceiling assembly with a storage garage or that is adjacent to an attic or crawl space to which the storage garage is also adjacent, a CO alarm shall be installed inside each bedroom, or outside each bedroom, within 5 m of each bedroom door, measured following corridors and doorways.
Every ash storage bin shall be constructed of noncombustible material.
Every opening in an ash storage bin shall be protected by a tight-fitting metal door with metal frame securely fastened to the bin.
Fireplaces shall conform to the requirements of Section ep001029.22

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in es007221b, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in et001102 (See en001281.)
The scope of this Part shall be as described in ep001032.3.3.
This Part applies to the design, construction, extension, alteration, renewal or repair of plumbing systems.

National Article Title: Conformance with Regulations or National Plumbing Code
National Sentence Text: Every plumbing system shall be designed and installed in conformance with appropriate provincial or territorial regulations or municipal bylaws, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the nrcc-npc.
Buildings shall be equipped with plumbing facilities as required in ep001023.7.2 and ea004559
Dwelling units shall be equipped with plumbing facilities as required in ep001029.31
Words that appear in italics are defined in ea004484.

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in es007221b, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in et001103 (See en001281.)
The scope of this Part shall be as described in ep001032.3.3.
This Part applies to fire safety and the protection of the public during the construction, alteration or demolition of every building, including any incompleted or abandoned building.
Fire safety at construction and demolition sites shall conform to Section 5.6. of Division B of the nrcc-nfc.
Words that appear in italics are defined in ea004484.
Measures shall be taken during demolition to protect the public in conformance with Section 5.6. of Division B of the nrcc-nfc.
Where a building is undergoing construction, alteration or demolition, measures shall be taken at the building site in conformance with this Code. (See en000246.)
Precautions shall be taken to ensure that no person is exposed to undue risk.

Where the construction may constitute a hazard to the public, work shall not commence on the construction, alteration or repair of a building until a covered way has been provided as described in ea000825 to protect the public, except where the work is done within a solid enclosure, the building is at a distance of 2 m or more from a public way used by pedestrians, or site conditions warrant a distance greater than provided in es001806b.

A covered way shall have a clear height of not less than 2.5 m, have a clear width of not less than 1.5 m or the width of the public way, whichever is the lesser, be designed and constructed to support safely all loads that may be reasonably expected to be applied to it, but in no case less than 2.4 kPa on the roof, have a weathertight roof sloped towards the site or, if flat, be equipped with a splash board not less than 300 mm high on the street side, be totally enclosed on the site side with a structure having a reasonably smooth surface facing the public way, have a railing 1 070 mm high on the street side where the covered way is supported by posts on the street side, and be adequately lighted when the public way is lighted.

When a construction or demolition activity may constitute a hazard to the public and is located 2 m or more from a public way, a strongly constructed fence, boarding or barricade not less than 1.8 m high shall be erected between the site and the public way or open sides of a construction site.
Barricades shall have a reasonably smooth surface facing the public way and shall be without openings, except those required for access.

Access openings through barricades shall be equipped with gates that shall be kept closed and locked when the site is unattended, and maintained in place until completion of the construction or demolition activity.

Where any special hazard exists from which it is not possible to protect the public by other means, persons shall be employed to prevent the public from entering the danger zone at any time of the day or night.

When work on a construction site is suspended or ceases so that it will not be occupied during normal working hours, the hazardous part of the construction site shall be protected by covering all windows, doors and other openings located within 3 m of the ground which may give access to the building with a securely fastened barricade, or a fence or barricade constructed according to the requirements of ea000826
Excavations shall be kept reasonably clear of water.

If the stability of adjoining buildings may be endangered by the work of excavating, adequate underpinning, shoring and bracing shall be provided to prevent damage to, or movement of, any part of the adjoining building, and the creation of a hazard to the public.
Except as provided in ea000863, provisions shall be made at all times for the safe passage of pedestrian and vehicular traffic past the site.
Material or equipment shall not be placed on any street or other public property except as authorized.
Except as provided in es001872, where a sidewalk exists adjacent to the site it shall be kept clear of obstructions at all times.
Where construction operations necessitate the obstruction of a sidewalk, a temporary sidewalk shall be provided and it shall be kept clear of obstruction at all times.

Operations such as the hoisting of major components onto a tall building or other overhead activities that constitute a hazard to pedestrians below from which the public cannot be protected by barricades, covered ways or similar means shall not be carried out until the street or other public way is closed.
Excavations in streets or public property shall be adequately barricaded, and have warning signs or lights installed on each section of the barricades referred to in es001874a.
All sidewalks, streets or other public property that have been damaged shall be restored to a safe condition.
All obstructions on sidewalks, streets or other public property shall be removed when the need for such obstructions is ended.
Warning lights shall be placed and shall be in operation during the hours of darkness at all obstructions on streets or other public ways.

Where a hazard to vehicular traffic on a public way is created by work on a construction site, the following shall be provided to direct the traffic: one or more workers, warning signs, barriers, lane control devices, or flashing lights or flares located at a suitable distance from the hazard.

A flag used to direct traffic shall be red, not less than 450 mm by 500 mm, mounted on a staff not less than 1 m long, with the long side of the flag attached securely to the staff along its entire length, and maintained in a clean and untorn condition when being used.

A sign used to direct traffic shall be diamond-shaped and of material not less rigid than 6 mm thick plywood, not less than 450 mm by 450 mm in size and mounted at one corner on a substantial pole not less than 1.2 m long, red on one side with black corner areas so that the red area is a regular 8-sided figure, and with the word “STOP” or “ARRÊT” in clearly distinguishable white letters not less than 150 mm high located centrally on the sign, yellow on the other side with the word “SLOW” or “LENTEMENT” in clearly distinguishable black letters not less than 150 mm high located centrally on the sign, or symbols recognized by the International Traffic Code, and maintained in a clean condition when being used.

A worker who is directing traffic shall be equipped as required by ea000871, be instructed in the signals to be used in controlling traffic, be provided with a copy of written instructions on the correct methods for traffic direction, and direct traffic by using either a flag or sign.

A worker while directing traffic shall wear the following clothing which shall be fluorescent and coloured either blaze orange or red: a vest, or sleeves that extend from above the elbow to the wrist.
Waste material or other material shall not be permitted to fall freely from one storey to another.

Waste material shall be removed as quickly as possible by means of appropriate containers, an enclosed shaft or chute conforming to es008069, or a hoisting apparatus if large pieces or objects are involved.

Waste material cleared as provided in es001884 shall be deposited in an enclosure so arranged as to prevent waste material from being projected beyond the confines of the enclosure, and not accessible to the public.
The chute described in es001884b shall be closed if it is inclined more than 45° to the horizontal.

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in es007221b, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in et001104 (See en001281.)
The application of this Part shall be as described in ep001032.3.3. (See en000253 regarding application to seasonally and intermittently occupied buildings.)

National Article Title: Floor Area Limits for Secondary Suites
National Sentence Text: The total floor area of all storeys of a secondary suite shall be not more than the lesser of 80% of the total floor area of all storeys of the other dwelling unit, excluding the garage floor area and common spaces serving both dwelling units, and 80 m2.
Words in italics are defined in ea004484.

Except as provided in es008073 and Articles ea000883 and ea004688, unreinforced and nominally reinforced concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed, cured and tested in accordance with the requirements for “R” class concrete stated in Section 9 of csaa23.1.
Unreinforced and nominally reinforced site-batched concrete shall be designed, mixed, placed and cured in accordance with Articles ea000879 to ea000887
Except as provided in es008071, reinforced concrete shall be designed to conform to the requirements of Part 4.

For flat insulating concrete form walls not exceeding 2 storeys in building height and having a maximum floor to floor height of 3 m, in buildings of light-frame construction, the concrete and reinforcing shall comply with Part 4 or the concrete shall conform to csaa23.1, with a maximum aggregate size of 19 mm, and the reinforcing shall conform to csag30.18 have a minimum specified yield strength of 400 MPa, and be lapped a minimum of 450 mm for 10M bars and 650 mm for 15M bars (see also Articles ea004814 and ea004832 to ea004834).
Cement shall meet the requirements of csaa3001.

National Article Title: Concrete in Contact with Sulphate Soil
National Sentence Text: Concrete in contact with sulphate soil, which is deleterious to normal cement, shall conform to the requirements in Clause 4.1.1.6 of csaa23.1.

Aggregates shall consist of sand, gravel, crushed rock, crushed air-cooled blast furnace slag, expanded shale or expanded clay conforming to csaa23.1, and be clean, well-graded and free of injurious amounts of organic and other deleterious material.
Water shall be clean and free of injurious amounts of oil, organic matter, sediment or any other deleterious material.

Except as provided elsewhere in this Part, the compressive strength of unreinforced concrete after 28 days shall be not less than 15 MPa for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 20 MPa for floors other than those in garages and carports, and for garage and carport floors, and the exterior steps, 32 MPa, or 30 MPa where indigenous aggregates do not achieve 32 MPa with a 0.45 water to cementing material ratio.
Site-batched concrete used for garage and carport floors and exterior steps shall have air entrainment of 5 to 8%.

For pre-mixed concrete and for the site-batched concrete mixes described in et000162, the maximum ratio of water to cementing materials measured by weight shall not exceed 0.70 for walls, columns, fireplaces and chimneys, footings, foundation walls, grade beams and piers, 0.65 for floors other than those in garages and carports, and 0.45 for garage and carport floors, and exterior steps.
The size of aggregate in unreinforced site-batched concrete mixes referred to in es008075 shall not exceed 1/5 the distance between the sides of vertical forms, or 1/3 the thickness of flatwork.
Admixtures shall conform to astmc260 or astmc494m as applicable.

When the air temperature is below 5°C, concrete shall be kept at a temperature of not less than 10°C or more than 25°C while being mixed and placed, and maintained at a temperature of not less than 10°C for 72 h after placing.
No frozen material or ice shall be used in concrete described in es001900.
Lumber for joists, rafters, trusses and beams and for the uses listed in et000163 shall be identified by a grade stamp to indicate its grade as determined by nlga_sgrcl. (See en000255.)
Except for joists, rafters, trusses and beams, visually graded lumber shall conform to the grades in et000163 (See ea001464 for joists, rafters and beams and ea001514 for trusses.)
Machine stress rated lumber shall conform to the requirements of ep001024.3.1

OSB, waferboard and plywood used for roof sheathing, wall sheathing and subflooring shall be legibly identified on the face of the material indicating the manufacturer of the material, the standard to which it is produced, and that the material is of an exterior type.
Moisture content of lumber shall be not more than 19% at the time of installation.
Lumber dimensions referred to in this Part are actual dimensions determined in conformance with csao141.

The thicknesses specified in this Part for plywood, hardboard, particleboard, OSB and waferboard shall be subject to the tolerances permitted in the standards referenced for these products unless specifically indicated herein.

Joist, rafter, lintel and beam members up to 5% less than the actual Canadian standard sizes are permitted to be used provided the allowable spans for the grade and species of lumber under consideration are reduced 5% from those shown in the Span Tables for full size members. (See en000256.)

In localities where termites are known to occur, clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level directly below them shall be not less than 450 mm and, except as provided in es008076, all sides of the supporting elements shall be visible to permit inspection, or structural wood elements, supported by elements in contact with the ground or exposed over bare soil, shall be pressure-treated with a chemical that is toxic to termites. (See en001202.)

In localities where termites are known to occur and foundations are insulated or otherwise finished in a manner that could conceal a termite infestation, a metal or plastic barrier shall be installed through the insulation and any other separation or finish materials above finished ground level to control the passage of termites behind or through the insulation, separation or finish materials, and all sides of the finished supporting assembly shall be visible to permit inspection.

Structural wood elements shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the vertical clearance between structural wood elements and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm (see also Articles ea001455 and ea001456), or where the wood elements are not protected from exposure to precipitation, the configuration is conducive to moisture accumulation, and the moisture index is greater than 1.00. (See en001203.)

Structural wood elements used in retaining walls and cribbing shall be pressure-treated with a preservative to resist decay, where the retaining wall or cribbing supports ground that is critical to the stability of building foundations, or the retaining wall or cribbing is greater than 1.2 m in height. (See en001204.)

Where wood is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay, such treatment shall be in accordance with Table 2, Use Categories for Specific Products, Uses, and Exposures, of csao80.1 as follows: Use Category 1 (UC1), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member remains dry, Use Category 2 (UC2), where the wood member is used in interior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member may be subjected to occasional sources of moisture, Use Category 3.2 (UC3.2), where the wood member is used in exterior construction, above-ground applications, and applications where the wood member is uncoated or is used in a configuration conducive to moisture accumulation, Use Category 4.1 (UC4.1), where the wood member is in contact with the ground, the wood member is in contact with fresh water, or the vertical clearance between the wood element and the finished ground level is less than 150 mm and the wood elements are not separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier, or Use Category 4.2 (UC4.2), where the wood member is used in critical structural components, including permanent wood foundations.

Where wood is protected in accordance with UC1 or UC2 using an inorganic boron preservative, the wood shall be protected from direct exposure to water during and after the completion of construction, and separated from permeable supporting materials by a moisture barrier that is resistant to all expected mechanisms of deterioration in the service environment if the vertical clearance to the ground is less than 150 mm.

Wood that is required by this Article to be treated to resist termites or decay shall be identified by a mark to indicate the type of preservative used and conformance to the relevant required Use Category.

Minimum thicknesses for sheet metal material that are stated in this Part refer to the actual minimum base metal thicknesses measured at any point of the material and, in the case of galvanized steel described in es008083, include the thickness of the galvanizing coating unless otherwise indicated.
Where sheet steel is required to be galvanized, it shall be metallic-coated with zinc or an alloy of 55% aluminum-zinc meeting the requirements of astma653m or astma792m.

Where galvanized sheet steel is intended for use in locations exposed to the weather or as a flashing material, it shall have a zinc coating not less than the G90 [Z275] coating designation or an aluminum-zinc alloy coating not less than the AZM150 coating designation, as referred to in es008083.

Subject to the application limitations defined elsewhere in this Part, structural members and their connections shall conform to requirements provided elsewhere in this Part, be designed according to good engineering practice such as that provided in cwc-egwfc or be designed according to Part 4 using the loads and deflection and vibration limits specified in Part 9, or Part 4.

Where floor framing is designed in accordance with es008085b or es008085c, and where supporting wall framing and fastenings, or footings are designed according to es008085a, the maximum specified live load on the floor according to et001029 shall not exceed 2.4 kPa.
Location-specific information for structural design, including snow and wind loads and seismic spectral accelerations, shall be determined according to ep001021.1.3

This Subsection applies to light-frame constructions whose wall, floor and roof planes are generally comprised of frames of small repetitive structural members, and where the roof and wall planes are clad, sheathed or braced on at least one side, the small repetitive structural members are spaced not more than 600 mm o.c., the clear span of any structural member does not exceed 12.2 m, the maximum deflection of the structural roof members conforms to ea004922, the maximum total roof area, notwithstanding any separation of adjoining buildings by firewalls, is 4 550 m2, and for flat roofs, there are no significant obstructions on the roof, such as parapet walls, spaced closer than the distance calculated byDo=10Ho-0.8Ss/gwhereDo = minimum distance between obstructions, m, Ho = height of the obstruction above the roof, m, Ss = ground snow load, kPa, and γ = specific weight of snow taken as 4.0 kN/m3 or 0.43Ss + 2.2 kN/m3, whichever is lesser.

Except as provided in Sentences es001920 to es008961, specified snow loads shall be not less than those calculated using the following formula: S=CbSs+SrwhereS = specified snow load, Cb = basic snow load roof factor, which is 0.45 where the entire width of the roof does not exceed 4.3 m and 0.55 for all other roofs, Ss = 1-in-50-year ground snow load in kPa, determined according to ep001021.1.3, and Sr = associated 1-in-50-year rain load in kPa, determined according to ep001021.1.3
In no case shall the specified snow load be less than 1 kPa.
Bow string, arch or semi-circular roof trusses having an unsupported span greater than 6 m shall be designed in conformance with the snow load requirements in Subsection ep001024.1.6

Where the height of a roof step at the intersection of an upper level roof and a lower level roof is greater than 2 m, and the upper level roof has a slope less than 1 in 6 and an area greater than 600 m2, the specified snow load on the lower level roof shall be for distances from the roof step that are less than or equal to the drift length, xd, calculated in accordance with es008962, not less than 1.5 times the specified snow load, S, calculated using the formula in es008098 with Cb equal to 0.55, and for distances from the roof step that are greater than the drift length, xd, calculated in accordance with es008962, as specified in es008098.

For the purposes of es008961, the drift length, xd, in m, shall be calculated as follows:xd=5h-0.55Ssgwhereh = height of the roof step, in m, and γ = specific weight of snow as specified in es007603f.

National Article Title: Platforms Subject to Snow and Occupancy Loads
National Sentence Text: Balconies, decks and other accessible exterior platforms intended for an occupancy and subject to snow loads shall be designed to carry the specified roof snow load or 1.9 kPa, whichever is greater, where the platform, or each segregated area of the platform, serves a single dwelling unit. (See en001207.)

The ceiling joists or truss bottom chords in residential attic or roof spaces having limited accessibility that precludes the storage of equipment or material shall be designed for a total specified load of not less than 0.35 kPa, where the total specified load is the sum of the specified dead load plus the specified live load of the ceiling. (See en001208.)
The maximum deflection of structural members shall conform to et001046
Dead loads need not be considered in computing deflections referred to in es001924.

Footing sizes for shallow foundations shall be determined in accordance with ep001029.15, or designed in accordance with ep001024.2 using the maximum allowable bearing pressures in et000165, or allowable bearing pressures determined from subsurface investigation.

National Article Title: Foundation Capacity in Weaker Soil and Rock
National Sentence Text: Where a soil or rock within a distance equal to twice the footing width below the bearing surface has a lower allowable bearing pressure than that at the bearing surface as shown in ea004696, the design capacity of the foundation shall not be greater than would cause the weakest soil or rock to be stressed beyond its allowable bearing pressure.

National Article Title: Foundation Capacity in Weaker Soil and Rock
National Sentence Text: In calculating subsurface pressures referred to in es001927, the loads from the footings shall be assumed to be distributed uniformly over a horizontal plane within a frustum extending downward from the footing at an angle of 60° to the horizontal.

Where a foundation bears on gravel, sand or silt, and the water table is within a distance below the bearing surface equal to the width of the foundation, the allowable bearing pressure shall be 50% of that determined in ea004696

Where a foundation is located in an area where soil movement caused by changes in soil moisture content, freezing, or chemical-microbiological oxidation is known to occur to the extent that it will damage a building, measures shall be taken to preclude such movement or to reduce its effects on the building so that the building's stability and the performance of assemblies will not be adversely affected. (See en001209.)
Walls shall be designed to resist the lateral pressure of the retained material.

Except where constructed in accordance with ep001029.15, walls supporting drained earth shall be designed for a pressure equivalent to that exerted by a fluid that has a density of not less than 480 kg/m3 and a depth equal to that of the retained earth, or in accordance with ep001024.2 so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in ea004572

Walls supporting other than drained earth shall be designed for the pressure described in es008103a plus the fluid pressure of the surcharge, or in accordance with ep001024.2 so as to be able to resist the loads and effects described in ea004572
Unless otherwise indicated herein, dimensions of rooms or spaces shall be measured between finished wall surfaces and between finished floor and ceiling surfaces.

Two or more areas may be considered as a combination room if the opening between the areas occupies the larger of 3 m2 or 40% or more of the area of the wall measured on the side of the dependent area.
Where the dependent area is a bedroom, direct passage shall be provided between the two areas.
Except as provided in Articles ea000915 and ea000584, every building shall be designed in conformance with Section ep001023.8

National Article Title: Protection on Floor Areas with a Barrier-Free Path of Travel
National Sentence Text: Where a barrier-free path of travel required in ea000913 is provided to any storey above the first storey, the requirements in ea000429 shall apply.

Except as provided in es001938, if the building is not equipped with an elevator, the barrier-free path of travel described in ep001023.8 need only be provided on the entrance level of an apartment building.

The barrier-free path of travel on the entrance level described in es001937 need not be provided where the difference in floor elevation between the entrance level and every dwelling unit exceeds 600 mm.

National Article Title: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es016061 and es016062, the ceiling heights and clear heights in rooms or spaces in residential occupancies shall conform to et001047

National Article Title: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
National Sentence Text: Ceiling heights in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.95 m.

National Article Title: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
National Sentence Text: Clear heights under beams and ducting in secondary suites shall be not less than 1.85 m.

National Article Title: Ceiling Heights of Rooms or Spaces
National Sentence Text: Areas in rooms or spaces over which ceiling height and clear height are not less than the minimum specified in et001047 or es016061 or es016062 shall be contiguous with the entry or entries to those rooms or spaces.
The ceiling height above and below a mezzanine floor assembly in occupancies other than residential occupancies shall be not less than 2.1 m.
The clear height in a storage garage shall be not less than 2 m.

The unobstructed width of a hallway within a dwelling unit shall be not less than 860 mm, except that the hallway width is permitted to be 710 mm where there are only bedrooms and bathrooms at the end of the hallway furthest from the living area, and a second exit is provided in the hallway near the end farthest from the living area, or in each bedroom served by the hallway.

Except as provided in es016345 and Articles ea000924, ea004748and ea004749, doorway openings within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be designed to accommodate at least the door sizes given in et000167 for swing-type and folding doors.
Doorway openings within secondary suites shall be designed to accommodate swing-type and folding doors not less than 1 890 mm high where the ceiling height complies with es016061.
Doorways to public water-closet rooms shall be not less than 810 mm wide and 2 030 mm high.

National Article Title: Doorways to Rooms with a Bathtub, Shower or Water Closet
National Sentence Text: This Article applies where a hallway of not less than 860 mm wide serves one or more rooms containing a bathtub, shower or water closet.

National Article Title: Doorways to Rooms with a Bathtub, Shower or Water Closet
National Sentence Text: At least one doorway in a hallway described in es001948 shall be constructed so that access is provided to not less than 1 of each type of fixture described in es001948, and to accommodate a door not less than 760 mm wide.

This Section applies to glass in interior doors and interior windows and their sidelights, clothes closets, site-built exterior windows, doors and skylights, shower or bathtub enclosures, glazed panels and partitions, and the protection of glass.
Glass shall conform to cgsb-12.1 cgsb-12.2 cgsb-12.3 cgsb-12.4 cgsb-12.8 cgsb-12.9, cgsb-12.10 cgsb-12.11, or astme2190.
Mirrored glass doors are only permitted to be used at the entrance to clothes closets and shall conform to the requirements of cgsb-82.6. (See en000261.)
Except as provided in es000003, glass shall be designed in conformance with cgsb-12.20,or astme1300. (See also ea000717)

Where the building has an essentially uniform distribution of paths for air leakage, including operable openings, but no large openings that would permit wind gusts to rapidly enter the building and the building is not in an exceptionally exposed location such as a hilltop, the maximum area of individual panes of glass for windows shall conform to Tables et000258 to et000260, where the building has a height from grade to the uppermost roof of 12 m or less, and is located in a built-up area, no less than 120 m away from the boundary between this area and open terrain, or Tables et001228 to et001230. (See en000272.)
The maximum area of individual panes of glass for doors shall conform to et001048.

National Article Title: Types of Glazing and Protection of Glazing
National Sentence Text: Glass sidelights greater than 500 mm wide that could be mistaken for doors, glass in storm doors and glass in sliding doors within or at every entrance to a dwelling unit and in public areas shall be safety glazing of the tempered or laminated type conforming to cgsb-12.1 or wired glass conforming to cgsb-12.11.

National Article Title: Types of Glazing and Protection of Glazing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es001995, glass in entrance doors to dwelling units and in public areas, other than the entrance doors described in es001957, shall be safety glazing or wired glass of the type described in es001957 where the glass area exceeds 0.5 m2 and extends to less than 900 mm from the bottom of the door.

National Article Title: Types of Glazing and Protection of Glazing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es001995, transparent panels that could be mistaken as a means of egress shall be protected by barriers or railings.

National Article Title: Types of Glazing and Protection of Glazing
National Sentence Text: Sliding glass partitions that separate a public corridor from an adjacent occupancy and that are open during normal working hours need not conform to Sentences es001958, es001994 and es001960, except that such partitions shall be suitably marked to indicate their existence and position.

National Article Title: Types of Glazing and Protection of Glazing
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es001995, every glass or transparent door accessible to the public shall be equipped with hardware, bars or other permanent fixtures designed so that the existence and position of such doors is readily apparent.

National Article Title: Types of Glazing and Protection of Glazing
National Sentence Text: Glazing used for a shower or bathtub enclosure shall conform to Class A of cgsb-12.1.
This Section applies to windows, doors and skylights in buildings.
For the purpose of this Section, the term “skylight” refers to unit skylights, roof windows and tubular daylighting devices.
For the purpose of this Section, the term “doors” includes glazing in doors and sidelights for doors.
A door shall be provided at each entrance to a dwelling unit.
Main entrance doors to dwelling units shall be provided with a door viewer or transparent glazing in the door, or a sidelight.

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Minimum sizes of doorways and doors within a barrier-free path of travel shall conform to ep001029.5

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The protection of window and door openings to protect persons from falling through them shall conform to ea004738

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Properties of windows and doors within exits shall conform to ep001029.9

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required means of egress from bedrooms shall conform to ep001029.9.12

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The location and protection of windows, doors and skylights in order to control the spread of fire shall conform to ep001029.10.12

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Doors between dwelling units and attached garages shall conform to ea001148

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: The surface flame-spread rating for doors and skylights shall conform to ea001170

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and doors installed to provide the required access to a building for firefighting purposes shall conform to ep001029.10.20

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows and skylights installed to provide required non-heating season ventilation shall conform to ea001783

National Article Title: Other Requirements for Windows, Doors and Skylights
National Sentence Text: Windows, doors and skylights shall conform to the energy efficiency requirements in ep001029.37
