Where a basement is used primarily as a storage garage, the basement is permitted to be considered as a separate building for the purposes of this Section provided the floor above the basement and the exterior walls of the basement above the adjoining ground level are constructed as fire separations of masonry or concrete having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

Rooftop enclosures provided for elevator machinery, stairways or service rooms, used for no purpose other than for service to the building, shall not be considered as a storey in calculating the building height.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences es002201 and es002203, a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating shall not be pierced by openings into the assembly unless the assembly has been tested and rated for such openings.

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: A wall or ceiling membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating is permitted to be pierced by openings for electrical and similar service outlet boxes, provided such outlet boxes and the penetrations conform to ea003798

National Article Title: Permitted Openings in Wall and Ceiling Membranes
National Sentence Text: A membrane ceiling forming part of an assembly assigned a fire-resistance rating on the basis of et000456 or ex000109 is permitted to be pierced by openings leading to ducts within the ceiling space, provided the ducts, the amount of openings and their protection conform to the requirements of ex000109.
Where a building or part of a building is required to be of noncombustible construction, combustible elements shall be limited in conformance with the requirements in ep001023.1.5
Heavy timber construction shall be considered to have a 45 min fire-resistance rating when it is constructed in accordance with the requirements for heavy timber construction in ea004454
Except as permitted in ea000253, structural steel members used in construction required to have a fire-resistance rating shall be protected to provide the required fire-resistance rating.

National Article Title: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Floors and Roofs
National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the fire-resistance ratings of floors and roofs shall conform to et000173 (See ep001029.10.2 for mixed occupancies and ep001029.10.21 for construction camps.)

The requirements in et000173 for roof assemblies to have a fire-resistance rating are permitted to be waived in sprinklered buildings where the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with es000653, and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with es007656.

National Article Title: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Walls, Columns and Arches
National Sentence Text: Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, all loadbearing walls, columns and arches in the storey immediately below a floor or roof assembly shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than that required for the supported floor or roof assembly.

National Article Title: Fire-Resistance Ratings for Walls, Columns and Arches
National Sentence Text: Light-frame walls, columns, arches and beams as well as loadbearing steel elements that support floors between dwelling units in a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces shall be protected by not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board. (See en001551.)
Where an assembly is required to be of noncombustible construction and to have a fire-resistance rating, it shall be supported by noncombustible construction.
Construction supporting a service room need not conform to ea001093
Mezzanines required to be counted as storeys in Articles ea004759 and ea004760 shall be constructed in conformance with the requirements for “Floors Except Floors over Crawl Spaces” in et000173

Where a portion of a roof supports an occupancy, that portion shall be constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating conforming to the rating for “Floors Except Floors over Crawl Spaces” in et000173

Except as provided in Sentences es002214 and es002215, the floor assembly of every exterior passageway used as part of a means of egress shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min or be of noncombustible construction.
No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving buildings of Group D, E or F major occupancy that are not more than 2 storeys in building height.

No fire-resistance rating is required for floors of exterior passageways serving a house with a secondary suite, or a single dwelling unit where no suite is located above or below the dwelling unit (see also es016174).

Where a crawl space exceeds 1.8 m in height or is used for any occupancy or as a plenum in combustible construction or for the passage of flue pipes, it shall be considered as a basement in applying the requirements in ea001091

et000173 does not apply to a dwelling unit that has no other dwelling unit above or below it, houses with a secondary suite, where the floor framing is protected on the underside by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board, or a dwelling unit that is not above or below another major occupancy.

The fire-resistance ratings of floors, roofs, loadbearing walls, columns and arches need not conform to this Subsection if such assemblies conform in all respects to the appropriate requirements in ep001023.2
This Subsection applies to fire separations required between rooms and spaces in buildings, and smoke-tight barriers required in houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.
Except as permitted in ea001103, a wall or floor assembly required to be a fire separation shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of fire and retard the passage of smoke.
Except as permitted in ea001103, a wall or floor assembly required to be a smoke-tight barrier shall be constructed as a continuous barrier against the spread of smoke. (See en001552.)

Except as provided in es014622, the continuity of a fire separation where it abuts another fire separation or smoke-tight barrier, a floor, a ceiling, or a roof shall be maintained by a firestop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ulcs115, has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the abutting fire separation. (See en001552.) (See also en000032.)

Except as provided in es014622, joints located in a horizontal plane between a floor and an exterior wall shall be sealed by a firestop that, when subjected to the fire test method in astme2307, has an F rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the horizontal fire separation.

Except as provided in es014622, all gypsum board joints in the assemblies described in Sentences es002220 and es016174 shall conform to csaa82.31 to maintain the integrity of the smoke-tight barrier over the entire surface.

Joints between ceilings and walls, between floors and walls, and between walls at corners need not comply with Sentences es008238to es016177 where such joints consist of gypsum board that is attached to framing members and arranged so as to restrict the passage of flame and smoke through the joints. (See en001341.)

National Article Title: Openings to be Protected with Closures
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Articles ea001105 to ea003798, openings in required fire separations shall be protected with closures conforming to ep001029.10.13

National Article Title: Openings to be Protected with Closures
National Sentence Text: Doors in smoke-tight barriers shall be solid-core, wood doors at least 45 mm thick, and have a self-closing device. (See en001519.)
Except as permitted in Sentences es002223 to es002225, all floor assemblies shall be constructed as fire separations.
Floor assemblies contained within dwelling units and within houses with a secondary suite need not be constructed as fire separations.

Floor assemblies for which no fire-resistance rating is required by Subsection ep001029.10.8 and floors of mezzanines not required to be counted as storeys in Articles ea004759 and ea004760 need not be constructed as fire separations.
Where a crawl space is not required by ea001098 to be constructed as a basement, the floor above it need not be constructed as a fire separation.
Interconnected floor spaces shall conform to ep001023.2.8

National Article Title: General Requirements for Penetrations of Fire Separations
National Sentence Text: Except as required by es016035 and Articles ea004763 and ea003798 and as permitted by ea003799, penetrations of a required fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to be a fire separation shall be sealed by a firestop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ulcs115, has an F rating not less than the required fire-resistance rating for the fire separation, tightly fitted or cast in place, provided the penetrating item is made of steel, ferrous, copper, concrete or masonry, or sealed to maintain the integrity of the fire separation. (See en000289.)

National Article Title: General Requirements for Penetrations of Fire Separations
National Sentence Text: Penetrations of a firewall shall be sealed at the penetration by a firestop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ulcs115 has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating for the fire separation.

Except as provided in Sentences es002239 and es014623, piping for drain, waste, vent and central vacuum systems that is not located in a vertical shaft is permitted to penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating or a membrane that forms part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the penetration is protected in accordance with es002227a or es002227b.

Drain piping leading directly from a water closet through a concrete floor slab is permitted to penetrate a horizontal fire separation or a membrane that contributes to the required fire-resistance rating of a horizontal fire separation, provided the piping is noncombustible and the penetration is protected in accordance with es002227, or the piping is combustible and the penetration is sealed by a firestop conforming to es002227a.
Combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a vertical fire separation, provided it is not located in a vertical shaft.
In buildings containing two dwelling units only, combustible drain, waste and vent piping is permitted on one side of a horizontal fire separation.

Water distribution piping is permitted to partly or wholly penetrate a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the piping is noncombustible and the penetration is protected in accordance with es002227, or the piping is combustible and is not located in a vertical shaft, and the penetration is sealed by a firestop conforming to es002227a.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Outlet Boxes or Service Equipment in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es014625to es014628, outlet boxes are permitted to penetrate the membrane of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided they are sealed at the penetration by a firestop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ulcs115, has an FT rating not less than the fire-resistance rating of the fire separation. (See en001481.)

National Article Title: Penetrations by Outlet Boxes or Service Equipment in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es016035, noncombustible outlet boxes that penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating need not conform to es014624, provided they do not exceed 0.016 m2 in area, and an aggregate area of 0.065 m2 in any 9.3 m2 of surface area, and the annular space between the membrane and the noncombustible outlet boxes does not exceed 3 mm.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Outlet Boxes or Service Equipment in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es016035, combustible outlet boxes that penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating need not conform to es014624, provided the outlet boxes are separated from the remainder of the space within the assembly by an enclosure of not more than 0.3 m2 in area made of fire block material conforming to ea004778 (see en001482), or located in a space within the assembly that is filled with preformed fibre insulation processed from rock or slag conforming to ulcs702, and having a mass per unit area of not less than 1.22 kg/m2 of wall surface such that the exposed sides and back of the outlet box are encapsulated by the noncombustible insulation, and the outlet boxes do not exceed an aggregate area of 0.016 m2 in any individual enclosure as described in es014626a1 or any individual insulated space as described in es014626a2.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Outlet Boxes or Service Equipment in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Noncombustible outlet boxes conforming to es014625 are permitted to be located on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating and need not conform to es014624, provided they are separated from each other by a horizontal distance of not less than 600 mm, separated from each other and the remainder of the wall space by an enclosure conforming to es014626a1, or located in an insulated wall space in accordance with es014626a2.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Outlet Boxes or Service Equipment in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Combustible outlet boxes conforming to es014626 are permitted to be located on opposite sides of a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating and need not conform to es014624.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Outlet Boxes or Service Equipment in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Service equipment is permitted to penetrate a horizontal fire separation conforming to es002245, provided the penetration is sealed by a firestop that, when subjected to the fire test method in ulcs115, has an FT rating not less than the required fire-resistance rating for the fire separation, a firestop conforming to es002227a, where the service equipment is located entirely within the cavity of a wall assembly above and below the horizontal fire separation having a required fire-resistance rating, or a firestop conforming to es002227a, where the penetration is contained within the concealed space of a floor or ceiling assembly having a fire-resistance rating, located above a ceiling membrane providing a horizontal fire separation, or contained within a horizontal service space conforming to es002245 that is directly above or below a floor or ceiling.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Raceways, Sprinklers and Fire Dampers
National Sentence Text: Combustible totally enclosed raceways that are embedded in a concrete floor slab are permitted in an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating, provided the concrete cover between the raceway and the bottom of the slab is not less than 50 mm.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Raceways, Sprinklers and Fire Dampers
National Sentence Text: Totally enclosed raceways are permitted to penetrate a fire separation, provided they are sealed at the penetration by a firestop conforming to es002227a.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Raceways, Sprinklers and Fire Dampers
National Sentence Text: Sprinkler piping is permitted to penetrate a fire separation, provided the fire compartments on each side of the fire separation are sprinklered.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Raceways, Sprinklers and Fire Dampers
National Sentence Text: Sprinklers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the firestop requirements of ea004762 and es014629a, provided the annular space created by the penetration of a fire sprinkler is covered by a metal escutcheon plate in accordance with nfpa13.

National Article Title: Penetrations by Raceways, Sprinklers and Fire Dampers
National Sentence Text: Fire dampers are permitted to penetrate a fire separation or a membrane forming part of an assembly required to have a fire-resistance rating without having to meet the firestop requirements of es002227, provided the fire damper is installed in conformance with nfpa80, specifically designed with a firestop, or provided in conformance with es002203. (See also en001092.)

Combustible construction that abuts on or is supported by a noncombustible fire separation shall be constructed so that its collapse under fire conditions will not cause collapse of the fire separation.

National Article Title: Reduction in Thickness of Fire Separation by Beams and Joists
National Sentence Text: Where pockets for the support of beams or joists are formed in a masonry or concrete fire separation, the remaining total thickness of masonry and/or grout and/or concrete shall be not less than the required equivalent thickness shown for Type S monolithic concrete in et000281 of Appendix D for the required fire-resistance rating.

Except as provided in es002245, a horizontal service space or other concealed space located above a required vertical fire separation shall be divided at the fire separation by an equivalent fire separation within the space.

Where a horizontal service space or other concealed space is located above a required vertical fire separation other than a vertical shaft, such space need not be divided as required in es002244 provided the construction between such space and the space below is constructed as a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the vertical fire separation, except that where the vertical fire separation is not required to have a fire-resistance rating greater than 45 min, the fire-resistance rating of the ceiling may be reduced to 30 min.
Except as provided in es002247, residential occupancies shall be separated from all other major occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h.

Except as provided in es002248, a major occupancy classified as a residential occupancy shall be separated from other major occupancies classified as mercantile or medium-hazard industrial occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

Where not more than two dwelling units are located in a building containing a mercantile occupancy, such mercantile occupancy shall be separated from the dwelling units by a fire separation having not less than 1 h fire-resistance rating.
Not more than one suite of residential occupancy shall be contained within a building classified as a Group F, Division 2 major occupancy.

Except as required in ea001114 and as permitted by es002251, each suite in other than business and personal services occupancies shall be separated from adjoining suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

In sprinklered buildings, suites of business and personal services occupancy and mercantile occupancy that are served by public corridors conforming with es007706b are not required to be separated from each other by fire separations.

Except as provided in Sentences es002253 to es016179 and ea001201, suites in residential occupancies shall be separated from adjacent rooms and suites by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min.

Sleeping rooms in boarding and lodging houses where sleeping accommodation is provided for not more than 8 boarders or lodgers need not be separated from the remainder of the floor area as required in es002252 where the sleeping rooms form part of the proprietor's residence and do not contain cooking facilities.

Except as provided in es016179, dwelling units that contain 2 or more storeys including basements shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h. (See en000103.)

Walls and floor-ceiling framing in a house with a secondary suite that separate dwelling units from each other or dwelling units from ancillary spaces and common spaces need not comply with es002252, where the walls and floor-ceiling framing are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board installed on both sides of walls, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing. (See es016178 for closures.)

Except as otherwise required by this Part and as provided in Sentences es002256 to es008937, public corridors shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 45 min fire-resistance rating.

In other than residential occupancies, no fire-resistance rating is required for fire separations between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with es000653, and the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with es007656.

In other than residential occupancies, no fire separation is required between a public corridor and the remainder of the building if the floor area is sprinklered, the sprinkler system is electrically supervised in conformance with es000653, the operation of the sprinkler system will cause a signal to be transmitted to the fire department in conformance with es007656, and the corridor exceeds 5 m in width.

Where a public corridor is located in a house with a secondary suite, a continuous smoke-tight barrier of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board shall be installed on both sides of walls separating the corridor from the remainder of the building, and the underside of floor-ceiling framing separating the corridor from the remainder of the building. (See es016178 for closures.)

No fire separation is required in a sprinklered floor area between a public corridor and a space containing plumbing fixtures required by ea004548 and ep001029.31, provided the space and the public corridor are separated from the remainder of the storey by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required between the public corridor and the remainder of the storey, and the plumbing fixtures are not located within a dwelling unit or suite.
Except as provided in Sentences es002259 and es002260, a storage garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having not less than a 1.5 h fire-resistance rating.
Except as permitted in es002260, storage garages containing 5 motor vehicles or fewer shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation of not less than 1 h.

Where a storage garage serves only the dwelling unit to which it is attached or in which it is built, it shall be considered as part of that dwelling unit and the fire separation required in es002259 need not be provided between the garage and the dwelling unit.

Except as provided in es005877, where a storage garage is attached to or built into a building of residential occupancy, an air barrier system conforming to ep001029.25.3 shall be installed between the garage and the remainder of the building to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes, and every door between the garage and the remainder of the building shall conform to ea001148 (See en000290.)
Where membrane materials are used to provide the required airtightness in the air barrier system, all joints shall be sealed and structurally supported.
Except as provided in Sentences es002262 and es008245, a repair garage shall be separated from other occupancies by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.

Ancillary spaces directly serving a repair garage, including waiting rooms, reception rooms, tool and parts storage areas and supervisory office space, need not be separated from the repair garage but shall be separated from other occupancies as required in es002261.

The fire separation referred to in es002261 shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h, where the building is not more than one storey in building height, the building is operated as a single suite, and the only occupancy other than the repair garage is a mercantile occupancy.

Except as provided in es005879, where a building containing a repair garage also contains a dwelling unit, an air barrier system conforming to ep001029.25.3 shall be installed between the dwelling unit and the suite containing the garage to provide an effective barrier to gas and exhaust fumes. (See en000290.)
Where membrane materials are used to provide the required airtightness in the air barrier system, all joints shall be sealed and structurally supported.

National Article Title: Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
National Sentence Text: Where a vertical service space contains an exhaust duct that serves more than one fire compartment, the duct shall have a fan located at or near the exhaust outlet to ensure that the duct is under negative pressure.

National Article Title: Exhaust Ducts Serving More Than One Fire Compartment
National Sentence Text: Individual fire compartments referred to in es002263 shall not have fans that exhaust directly into the duct in the vertical service space.
A central vacuum system shall serve not more than one suite.
This Subsection applies to service rooms in all buildings except rooms located within a dwelling unit.
The fire-resistance rating requirements in this Subsection do not apply to the floor assembly immediately below a service room.

Except as provided in es002269 and Articles ea001124 and ea001125, service rooms shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 1 h when the floor area containing the service room is not sprinklered.
Where a room contains a limited quantity of service equipment and the service equipment does not constitute a fire hazard, the requirements in es002268 shall not apply.

Except as provided in Sentences es002271 and es016181 and ea001124, fuel-fired appliances shall be located in a service room separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating.

Except as required in the appliance installation standards referenced in Sentences es001673, es008590 and es008592, fuel-fired space-heating appliances, space-cooling appliances, service water heaters and laundry appliances need not be separated from the remainder of the building as required in es002270, where the appliances serve not more than one room or suite, or a building with a building area of not more than 400 m2 and a building height of not more than 2 storeys, or where the appliances serve a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, and are located in a service room where both sides of any wall assemblies and the underside of any floor-ceiling framing separating this room from both dwelling units or their common spaces are protected by a continuous smoke-tight barrier consisting of not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.
es002270 does not apply to fireplaces and cooking appliances.
Service rooms containing incinerators shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having a fire-resistance rating of not less than 2 h.
The design, construction, installation and alteration of each indoor incinerator shall conform to nfpa82.
Every incinerator shall be connected to a chimney flue conforming to the requirements in ep001029.21 and serving no other appliance.
An incinerator shall not be located in a room with other fuel-fired appliances.

Rooms for the temporary storage of combustible refuse and materials for recycling in all occupancies or for public storage in residential occupancies shall be separated from the remainder of the building by a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating, except that a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min is permitted where the fire-resistance rating of the floor assembly is not required to exceed 45 min, or the room is sprinklered.
Except as provided in ea001127, a party wall on a property line shall be constructed as a firewall. (See en001538.)

Except as stated in es016379, a party wall on a property line of a building of residential occupancy need not be constructed as a firewall, provided it is constructed as a fire separation having not less than a 1 h fire-resistance rating, where the party wall separates two dwelling units where there is no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, a dwelling unit and a house with a secondary suite including their common spaces, or two houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces.

Where a building of residential occupancy contains more than 2 houses, a party wall that separates any 2 adjacent houses with a secondary suite from the rest of the building shall be constructed as a firewall to create separate buildings each containing no more than 2 adjacent houses with a secondary suite.
The wall described in es002278 shall provide continuous protection from the top of the footings to the underside of the roof deck.
Any space between the top of the wall described in es002278 and the roof deck shall be tightly filled with mineral wool or noncombustible material.
Where firewalls are used, the requirements in ep001023 shall apply.

Except as provided in es002285 and in Articles ea001073 and ea001105, the portions of a floor area or mezzanine that do not terminate at an exterior wall, a firewall or a vertical shaft, shall terminate at a vertical fire separation having a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the floor assembly that terminates at the separation.
A mezzanine need not terminate at a vertical fire separation where the mezzanine is not required to be considered as a storey in Articles ea004759 and ea004760

Where a wall in a building is exposed to a fire hazard from an adjoining roof of a separate fire compartment that is not sprinklered in the same building, the roof shall contain no skylights within a horizontal distance of 5 m of the windows in the exposed wall.

National Article Title: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in ea001023, where exterior walls of a building meet at an external angle of 135° or less, the horizontal distance from an unprotected opening in one exterior wall to an unprotected opening in the other exterior wall shall be not less than 1.2 m, where these openings are in different fire compartments, or in different dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite.

National Article Title: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es016182, the exterior wall of each fire compartment referred to in es002287 within the 1.2 m distance shall have a fire-resistance rating not less than that required for the interior vertical fire separation between the compartment and the remainder of the building.

National Article Title: Exterior Walls Meeting at an Angle
National Sentence Text: Where interior walls between dwelling units, ancillary spaces or common spaces in a house with a secondary suite are not constructed as fire separations, the exterior wall of each dwelling unit, ancillary space or common space referred to in es002287 within the 1.2 m distance shall be finished on the interior with not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum board.

This Article applies to the portion of any soffit enclosing a projection that is less than 2.5 m vertically above a window or door, and less than 1.2 m from either side of the window or door. (See en000291.)

Except as provided in Sentences es008251 and es008252, the construction described in es008248 shall have no unprotected openings and shall be protected in accordance with es008250, where the soffit encloses a common attic or roof space that spans more than 2 suites of residential occupancy and projects beyond the exterior wall of the building, a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey and a fire separation is required at the floor between the two, or the floor separates dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite, or a floor space where an upper storey projects beyond the exterior wall of a lower storey, and the projection is continuous across a vertical fire separation separating two suites, or a wall separating dwelling units from each other or a dwelling unit from an ancillary space or a common space in a house with a secondary suite.

Protection required by es008249 shall be provided by noncombustible material having a minimum thickness of 0.38 mm and a melting point not below 650°C, not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum board installed according to csaa82.31 not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See en001229.)

In the case of a soffit described in es008248 that is at the edge of an attic or roof space and completely separated from the remainder of that attic or roof space by fire blocks, the requirements in es008249 do not apply.

Where all suites spanned by a common attic or roof space or situated above or below the projecting floor are sprinklered, the requirements of es008249 do not apply, provided that all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, having openings in the wall beneath the soffit are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exceptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in ea004501

Except as provided in ea004766, openings in required fire separations shall be protected with a closure conforming to et000174 and shall be installed in conformance with Chapters 2 to 14 of nfpa80, unless otherwise specified herein. (See also ea001079)

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text: A 45 mm thick solid core wood door is permitted to be used where a minimum fire-protection rating of 20 min is permitted or between a public corridor and a suite provided that the door conforms to ulcs113. (See en000292.)

National Article Title: Solid Core Wood Door as a Closure
National Sentence Text: Doors described in es002293 shall have not more than a 6 mm clearance beneath and not more than 3 mm at the sides and top.

Doors required to provide a 20 min fire-protection rating or permitted to be 45 mm solid core wood shall be mounted in a wood frame of not less than 38 mm thickness where the frame has not been tested and rated.

National Article Title: Doors as a Means of Egress
National Sentence Text: Doors forming part of an exit or a public means of egress shall conform to ep001029.9.6 in addition to this Subsection.

Wired glass conforming to ea000954 which has not been tested in accordance with ea001079 is permitted as a closure in a vertical fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h provided such glass is not less than 6 mm thick and is mounted in conformance with es002299.
Wired glass described in es002298 shall be mounted in fixed steel frames having a metal thickness of not less than 1.35 mm and a glazing stop of not less than 20 mm on each side of the glass.
Individual panes of glass described in es002298 shall not exceed 0.8 m2 in area or 1.4 m in height or width, and the area of glass not structurally supported by mullions shall not exceed 7.5 m2.
Steel door frames forming part of a closure in a fire separation, including anchorage requirements, shall conform to ulcs105.
Glass block that has not been tested in accordance with ea001079 is permitted as a closure in a fire separation required to have a fire-resistance rating of not more than 1 h.(See ea001370)

The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 11 m2, with no dimension greater than 3.7 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are not sprinklered.

The size of an opening in an interior fire separation, even where protected with a closure, shall not exceed 22 m2, with no dimension greater than 6 m, when the fire compartments on both sides of the fire separation are sprinklered.
Every swing type door in a fire separation shall be equipped with a latch.
Except as described in es002307, every door in a fire separation shall have a self-closing device.
Self-closing doors are not required between public corridors and suites in business and personal services occupancies, except in dead-end corridors.
Where hold-open devices are used on doors in required fire separations, they shall be installed in accordance with ea000204

Swing-type doors shall open into service rooms containing fuel-fired equipment where such doors lead to public corridors or rooms used for assembly but shall swing outward from such rooms in all other cases.

Except as permitted by Sentences es002311 to es002314, es002203 and es014634, a duct that penetrates an assembly required to be a fire separation with a fire-resistance rating shall be equipped with a fire damper in conformance with Articles ea000196 and ea000201

A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation provided the duct has a melting point not below 760°C, has a cross-sectional area less than 130 cm2, and supplies only air-conditioning units or combined air-conditioning and heating units discharging air at not more than 1.2 m above the floor.

A fire damper is not required where a noncombustible branch duct pierces a required fire separation around an exhaust duct riser in which the airflow is upward provided the melting point of the branch duct is not below 760°C, the branch duct is carried up inside the riser not less than 500 mm, and the exhaust duct is under negative pressure as described in ea001118

Noncombustible ducts that penetrate a fire separation separating a vertical service space from the remainder of the building need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation provided the ducts have a melting point above 760°C, and each individual duct exhausts directly to the outside at the top of the vertical service space.
A duct serving commercial cooking equipment and piercing a required fire separation need not be equipped with a fire damper at the fire separation. (See also ea004653)

Fire stop flaps in ceiling membranes referred to in es002203 shall conform to ulcs1122 and activate at a temperature approximately 30°C above the normal maximum temperature that occurs in the ducts, whether the air duct system is operating or shut down.

National Article Title: Doors between Garages and Dwelling Units
National Sentence Text: A door between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall be tight fitting and weather-stripped to provide an effective barrier against the passage of gas and exhaust fumes and shall be fitted with a self-closing device.

National Article Title: Doors between Garages and Dwelling Units
National Sentence Text: A doorway between an attached or built-in garage and a dwelling unit shall not be located in a room intended for sleeping.
Where a door is installed so that it may damage the integrity of a fire separation if its swing is unrestricted, door stops shall be installed to prevent such damage.
This Subsection applies to buildings other than those to which ep001029.10.15 applies.
This Subsection does not apply to detached carports conforming to ep001029.35 that serve not more than onedwelling unit or a house with a secondary suite.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, or the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min.

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using et001053 to determine the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no unprotected openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See en000045.)

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using et000176 to determine the required type of construction, cladding and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured, and the value for the maximum area of unprotected openings (see second column of et000176) shall be determined using the limiting distance measured from the location described in es008257a. (See en000045.)

National Article Title: Limiting Distance and Fire Department Response
National Sentence Text: Except for the purpose of applying Sentences es002323, es016297, es008263 and es008264, and Sentences es008268, es016302 and es002341, a limiting distance equal to half the actual limiting distance shall be used as input to the requirements of this Subsection, where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle arrives at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to the building, and any storey in the building is not sprinklered. (See Notes en001530 and en001537.)

Except as provided in Sentences es008261 to es008265, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face shall conform to et001053, conform to ep001023.2.3, or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared, for residential occupancies, business and personal services occupancies and low-hazard industrial occupancies, and half the limiting distance squared, for mercantile occupancies and medium-hazard industrial occupancies.

Openings in a wall having a limiting distance of less than 1.2 m shall be protected by closures, of other than wired glass or glass block, whose fire-protection rating is in conformance with the fire-resistance rating required for the wall. (See et000174)

Except for buildings that are sprinklered and for openable windows having an unobstructed opening equal to 0.35 m2 installed in accordance with Sentences es008113 and es008114, where the limiting distance is 2 m or less, individual unprotected openings shall be no greater than the area stated in et001226, or where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 1.2 m, the area calculated byArea=0.242×LD-1.22whereArea = area of the unprotected opening, and LD = limiting distance.

The spacing between individual unprotected openings described in es016297 that serve a single room or space described in es016299 shall be not less than 2 m horizontally of another unprotected opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or 2 m vertically of another unprotected opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.

For the purpose of es016298, “single room or space” shall mean two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.

The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings is permitted to be up to twice the area determined according to es008259, where the unprotected openings are glazed with wired glass in steel frames, as described in ea001138, or glass blocks, as described in ea001140

Where the building is sprinklered, the maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings is permitted to be up to twice the area determined according to es008259, provided all rooms, including closets and bathrooms, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have unprotected openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in ea004501

The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storage garage need not comply with es008259, where all storeys are constructed as open-air storeys, and the storage garage has a limiting distance of not less than 3 m.

The maximum aggregate area of unprotected openings in an exposing building face of a storey that faces a street and is at the same level as the street need not comply with es008259, where the limiting distance is not less than 9 m.

Except as provided in es008266, for garages or accessory buildings that serve a single dwelling unit only and are detached from any building, the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings shall comply with the requirements for unprotected openings.

The limits on the area of glazed openings stated in es008265 need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in Sentences es008268 to es008273, each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with et000176. (See en001567.) (See also ep001029.10.8)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es008268 to es016302, cladding on exposing building faces and exterior walls located above exposing building faces that enclose an attic or roof space, for buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 10% of the exposing building face, need not be noncombustible where the wall assembly complies with the requirements of es000195b when tested in conformance with ulcs134.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es008269 to es016302 and permitted by es016303, cladding on exposing building faces and on exterior walls located above exposing building faces of buildings or fire compartments where the maximum permitted area of unprotected openings is more than 25% but not more than 50% of the exposing building face need not be noncombustible, where the limiting distance is greater than 5.0 m, the limiting distance is greater than 2.5 m where the area and width-to-height ratio of the exposing building face conform to et001227, the building or fire compartment is sprinklered, the cladding conforms to ep001029.27.6, ep001029.27.7, ep001029.27.9 or ep001029.27.10, is installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with astmd2898 has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with es000342, or the cladding conforms to ep001029.27.13, is installed with or without furring members over a gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, has a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with es000342, and does not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es008270, where a garage or accessory building serves one dwelling unit only and is detached from any building, the exposing building face need not conform to the minimum required fire-resistance rating stated in et000176, where the limiting distance is 0.6 m or more, shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, and need not conform to the type of cladding and type of construction required by et000176, regardless of the limiting distance.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating, type of construction and type of cladding need not apply to the exposing building face of a detached garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es016301, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 m above ground level and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es016303 to es016305, es002336 shall not apply to buildings containing one or two dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property. (See en001520.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Where combustible projections on an exposing building face are permitted by es016301, are totally enclosed and constructed with solid faces, such as for fireplaces and chimneys, and extend within 1.2 m of a property line, the construction of the face and sides of the projection shall comply with the corresponding requirements for exposing building faces for limiting distances less than 1.2 m as stated in es016300 or es008268, and where the underside of the projection is more than 0.6 m above finished ground level, it shall be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick noncombustible material, unvented aluminum conforming to cgsb-93.2 not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to csaa82.31 not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See en001572.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es000019, where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See en001539.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es000019, where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See en001539.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a public way. (See en000947.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Where roof soffits project to less than 1.2 m from the property line, the centre line of a public way, or an imaginary line between two buildings or fire compartments on the same property, they shall have no openings, and be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick sheet steel, unvented aluminum conforming to cgsb-93.2 not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to csaa82.31 not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See en001539.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of es008267, provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face and Walls above Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Non-loadbearing wall components need not have a minimum fire-resistance rating, where the building is 1 storey in building height, is of noncombustible construction, is classified as a low-hazard industrial occupancy and used only for low fire load occupancies, such as power-generating plants or plants for the manufacture or storage of noncombustible materials, and has a limiting distance of 3 m or more.

This Subsection applies to buildings that contain only dwelling units and have no dwelling unit above another dwelling unit, and houses with a secondary suite including their common spaces. (See en001232.)

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The area of an exposing building face shall be taken as the exterior wall area facing in one direction on any side of a building, and calculated as the total area measured from the finished ground level to the uppermost ceiling, the area for each fire compartment, where a building is divided into fire compartments by fire separations with fire-resistance ratings not less than 45 min, or except as provided in es016068, where et001054 is used to determine the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings, the area of any number of individual portions of the exposing building face. (See en001230.)

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Where the exposing building face of any section of an exterior wall enclosing a single room or space, or combination room and space, has a limiting distance of 2 m or less, that section of the exposing building face serving the room or space shall not be divided into portions for the purpose of calculating area of exposing building face. (See es016308 and en001230.)

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of using et001054 to determine the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings in an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that there are no glazed openings between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See en000045.)

National Article Title: Area and Location of Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: In determining the required cladding-sheathing assembly and fire-resistance rating for an irregularly shaped or skewed exterior wall, the location of the exposing building face shall be taken as a vertical plane located so that no portion of the actual exposing building face is between the vertical plane and the line to which the limiting distance is measured. (See ea004777 and en000045.)

National Article Title: Limiting Distance and Fire Department Response
National Sentence Text: Except for the purpose of applying Sentences es016068, es016306 and es008089, a limiting distance equal to half the actual limiting distance shall be used as input to the requirements of this Subsection, where the time from receipt of notification of a fire by the fire department until the first fire department vehicle arrives at the building exceeds 10 min in 10% or more of all calls to the building, and any storey in the building is not sprinklered. (See Notes en001530 and en001537.)

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es008282and es008966, the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings in an exposing building face shall conform to et001054, conform to ep001023.2.3, or where the limiting distance is not less than 1.2 m, be equal to or less than the limiting distance squared.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Where the limits on the area of glazed openings are determined for individual portions of the exposing building face, as described in es008275b3, the maximum aggregate area of glazed openings for any portion shall be determined using the values in et001054 corresponding to the maximum total area of exposing building face, which is equal to the sum of all portions of the exposing building face, and the limiting distance of each portion. (See en001230.)

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: Except for buildings that are sprinklered and for openable windows having an unobstructed opening equal to 0.35 m2 installed in accordance with Sentences es008113 and es008114, where the limiting distance is 2 m or less, individual glazed openings or a group of glazed openings in an exposing building face shall not exceed 50% of the maximum allowable aggregate area of glazed openings determined in es008280.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The spacing between individual glazed openings described in es016306 serving a single room or space described in es016308 shall be not less than 2 m horizontally of another glazed opening that is on the same exposing building face and serves the single room or space, or 2 m vertically of another glazed opening that serves the single room or space, or another room or space on the same storey.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: For the purpose of es016307, “single room or space” shall mean two or more adjacent spaces having a full-height separating wall extending less than 1.5 m from the interior face of the exterior wall, or two or more stacked spaces that are on the same storey.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The limits on the area of glazed openings shall not apply to the exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Article Title: Glazed Openings in Exposing Building Face
National Sentence Text: The maximum aggregate area of glazed openings in an exposing building face is permitted to be up to twice the area determined in accordance with es008280, where the glazed openings consist of glass blocks, as described in ea001140, or the building is sprinklered, provided all rooms, including closets, bathrooms and attached garages, that are adjacent to the exposing building face and that have glazed openings are sprinklered, notwithstanding any exemptions in the sprinkler standards referenced in ea004501

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es008286 and es002341, each exposing building face and any exterior wall located above an exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall be constructed in conformance with Sentences es008285 and es016069 for the exposing building face as a whole, or for any number of separate portions of the exposing building face (see es008275b3, es008281, and en001230). (See also ep001029.10.8)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es008286 and es008088, where the limiting distance is less than 0.6 m, the exposing building face and exterior walls located above the exposing building face that enclose an attic or roof space shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, and the cladding shall be metal or noncombustible cladding installed in accordance with ep001029.20, ep001029.27 or ep001029.28 (see en001567), the cladding shall conform to ep001029.27.13, be installed without furring members over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, have a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with es000342, and not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements, or the wall assembly shall comply with es000195b when tested in conformance with ulcs134.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es008286, where the limiting distance is equal to or greater than 0.6 m and less than 1.2 m, the exposing building face and any exterior wall located above the exposing building face that encloses an attic or roof space shall have a fire-resistance rating of not less than 45 min, and the cladding shall be metal or noncombustible cladding installed in accordance with ep001029.20, ep001029.27.12 or ep001029.28 (see en001567), the cladding shall conform to ep001029.27.6, ep001029.27.7, ep001029.27.9, ep001029.27.10, or ep001029.27.11, be installed without furring members, or on furring not more than 25 mm thick, over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, and after conditioning in conformance with astmd2898 have a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with es000342, the cladding shall conform to ep001029.27.13, be installed with or without furring members over gypsum sheathing at least 12.7 mm thick or over masonry, have a flame-spread rating not greater than 25 when tested in accordance with es000342, and not exceed 2 mm in thickness exclusive of fasteners, joints and local reinforcements, or the wall assembly shall comply with es000195b when tested in conformance with ulcs134.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: The requirements regarding fire-resistance rating and type of cladding-sheathing assembly shall not apply to the exposing building face or projections from an exposing building face of a dwelling unit facing a detached garage or accessory building, or a garage or accessory building facing a dwelling unit, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es016309, combustible projections on the exterior of a wall that are more than 1 m above ground level and that could expose an adjacent building to fire spread shall not be permitted within 1.2 m of a property line or the centre line of a public way, or 2.4 m of a combustible projection on another building on the same property.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es016311 to es016313, es008088 shall not apply to buildings containing one or two dwelling units only, and detached garages or accessory buildings, where the detached garage or accessory building serves only one dwelling unit, the detached garage or accessory building is located on the same property as that dwelling unit, and the dwelling unit served by the detached garage or accessory building is the only major occupancy on the property. (See en001520.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Where combustible projections on an exposing building face are permitted by es016309, are totally enclosed and constructed with solid faces, such as for fireplaces and chimneys, and extend within 1.2 m of a property line, the construction of the face and sides of the projection shall comply with the corresponding requirements for exposing building faces for limiting distances less than 1.2 m as stated in es008285 or es016069, and where the underside of the projection is more than 0.6 m above finished ground level, it shall be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick noncombustible material, unvented aluminum conforming to cgsb-93.2 not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to csaa82.31 not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See en001572.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es000020, where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of not more than 0.45 m, projecting roof soffits shall not be constructed above the exposing building face. (See en001539.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es000020, where the exposing building face has a limiting distance of more than 0.45 m, the face of roof soffits shall not project to less than 0.45 m from the property line. (See en001539.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: The face of a roof soffit is permitted to project to the property line, where it faces a public way . (See en000947.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Where roof soffits project to less than 1.2 m from the property line, the centre line of a public way, or an imaginary line between two buildings or fire compartments on the same property, they shall have no openings, and be protected by not less than 0.38 mm thick sheet steel, unvented aluminum conforming to cgsb-93.2 not less than 12.7 mm thick gypsum soffit board or gypsum ceiling board installed according to csaa82.31 not less than 11 mm thick plywood, not less than 12.5 mm thick OSB or waferboard, or not less than 11 mm thick lumber. (See en001539.)

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: For buildings of combustible construction, materials installed to provide the required protection for soffits may be covered with a combustible or noncombustible finish material.

National Article Title: Construction of Exposing Building Face of Houses
National Sentence Text: Heavy timber and steel columns need not conform to the requirements of es008283, provided the limiting distance is not less than 3 m.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Vertical concealed spaces in interior walls and exterior walls shall be separated by fire blocks one from the other, and from horizontal concealed spaces.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Horizontal concealed spaces in attics, roof spaces, ceilings, floors, and crawl spaces shall be separated by fire blocks one from the other, and from vertical concealed spaces.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at all interconnections between concealed vertical and horizontal spaces in interior coved ceilings, drop ceilings and soffits where the exposed construction materials within the concealed spaces have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Fire blocks shall be provided at the top and bottom of each run of stairs where they pass through a floor containing concealed space in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Where not sprinklered, concealed spaces of combustible construction created by a ceiling, roof space or unoccupied attic space shall be separated by fire blocks into compartments not more than 60 m in greatest dimension, and where such space contains exposed construction materials having a surface flame-spread rating greater than 25, not more than 300 m2 in area.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: No dimension of the concealed space described in es002347b shall exceed 20 m.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Concealed Spaces
National Sentence Text: Concealed spaces in mansard or gambrel style roofs, exterior cornices, balconies and canopies of combustible construction in which the exposed construction materials within the space have a surface flame-spread rating exceeding 25 shall have vertical fire blocks at intervals of not more than 20 m and at points where such concealed spaces extend across the ends of required vertical fire separations.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted in es002351, fire blocks shall be provided to block off concealed spaces within wall assemblies, including spaces created by furring, at each floor level, at each ceiling level where the ceiling contributes to part of the required fire-resistance rating, and at other locations within the wall, so that the distance between fire blocks does not exceed 20 m horizontally and 3 m vertically.

National Article Title: Required Fire Blocks in Wall Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Fire blocks described in es002350 are not required, provided the insulated wall assembly contains not more than one concealed air space whose horizontal thickness is not more than 25 mm, the exposed construction materials within the space are noncombustible, the exposed construction materials within the space, including insulation, but not including wiring, piping or similar services, have a flame-spread rating of not more than 25, or the concealed wall space is filled with insulation.

Except as permitted by Sentences es008289 and es008290, fire blocks shall be constructed of materials that will remain in place and prevent the passage of flames for not less than 15 min when subjected to the standard fire exposure in ulcs101.

Fire blocks are deemed to comply with es016037 if they are constructed of not less than 0.38 mm sheet steel, 12.7 mm gypsum board, 12.5 mm plywood, OSB or waferboard, with joints having continuous supports, two layers of lumber, each not less than 19 mm thick, with joints staggered, or 38 mm lumber.

In a building permitted to be of combustible construction, semi-rigid fibre insulation board produced from glass, rock or slag is permitted to be used to block the vertical space in a double-frame wall assembly formed at the intersection of the floor assembly and the walls, provided the width of the vertical space does not exceed 25 mm and the insulation board has a density not less than 45 kg/m3, is securely fastened to one set of studs, extends from below the bottom of the top plates in the lower storey to above the top of the bottom plate in the upper storey, and completely fills the portion of the vertical space between the headers and between the wall plates. (See en001099.)
Where fire blocks are pierced by pipes, ducts or other elements, the effectiveness of the fire blocks shall be maintained around such elements. (See also en001511.)

Except as otherwise provided in this Subsection, the exposed surface of every interior wall and ceiling, including skylights and glazing, shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 150.
Except as permitted in es002356, doors need not conform to es002354 provided they have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.
Doors within dwelling units, other than garage doors, need not conform to Sentences es002354 and es002355.

National Article Title: Ceilings in Exits or Public Corridors
National Sentence Text: At least 90% of the exposed surface of every ceiling in an exit or ceiling that is not sprinklered in a public corridor shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See ea001175)
Except as provided in es002359, at least 90% of the exposed surfaces of every wall in an exit shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See ea001175)
At least 75% of the wall surface of a lobby used as an exit in ea004755 shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See ea001175)

Where an exterior exit passageway provides the only means of egress from the rooms or suites it serves, the wall and ceiling finishes of that passageway, including the soffit beneath and the guard on the passageway, shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25, except that up to 10% of the total wall area and 10% of the total ceiling area is permitted to have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 150.

At least 90% of the total wall surface in any public corridor that is not sprinklered shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 75, or at least 90% of the upper half of such walls shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 25. (See ea001175)

National Article Title: Calculation of Wall and Ceiling Areas
National Sentence Text: Skylights, glazing, combustible doors, and combustible light diffusers and lenses shall not be considered in the calculation of wall and ceiling areas in this Subsection.

Where a public corridor or a corridor used by the public contains an occupancy, the interior finish materials used on the walls or ceiling of such occupancy, shall have a surface flame-spread rating in conformance with that required for public corridors.
Light diffusers and lenses having flame-spread ratings that exceed those permitted for the ceiling finish, shall conform to the requirements of es000351.

Individual combustible skylights in corridors required to be separated from the remainder of the building by fire separations shall not exceed 1 m2 in area and shall be spaced not less than 1.2 m apart.

Except as provided in Sentences es000021 and es002367, foamed plastics that form part of a wall or ceiling assembly shall be protected from adjacent space in the building, other than adjacent concealed spaces within attic or roof spaces, crawl spaces, wall assemblies and ceiling assemblies by one of the interior finishes described in Subsections ep001029.29.4 to ep001029.29.9, provided the building does not contain a Group C major occupancy, by sheet metal that is mechanically fastened to the supporting assembly independent of the insulation, is not less than 0.38 mm thick, and has a melting point not less than 650°C, or by any thermal barrier that meets the requirements of es005930. (See en000021.)

A walk-in cooler or freezer consisting of factory-assembled wall, floor or ceiling panels containing foamed plastics is permitted to be used, provided the panels are protected on both sides by sheet metal not less than 0.38 mm thick having a melting point not less than 650°C, do not contain an air space, and have a flame-spread rating, determined by subjecting a sample panel with an assembled joint typical of field installation to the applicable test described in ep001023.1.12, that is not more than that permitted for the room or space in which they are located or that they bound.

Thermosetting foamed plastic insulation having a flame-spread rating of not more than 200 is permitted to be used in factory-assembled doors in storage garages serving single dwelling units provided that the insulation is covered on the interior with a metallic foil, the assembly has a flame-spread rating of not more than 200, and the assembly incorporates no air spaces.
The interior finish of walls and ceilings in bathrooms within suites of residential occupancy shall have a surface flame-spread rating of not more than 200.
Where a covering or a lining is used with a duct, such lining or covering shall have a flame-spread rating conforming to ea000567 or ea001814
Where access is provided through a firewall, the requirements in this Subsection shall apply to the floor areas on both sides of the firewall as if they were in the same building.
Except as permitted in Sentences es016039 and es016040, a fire alarm system shall be installed in buildings in which a sprinkler system is installed.

Except as provided in es002372, a fire alarm system shall be installed in every building that contains more than 3 storeys, including storeys below the first storey, where the total occupant load exceeds 300, or when the occupant load for any major occupancy in et000177 is exceeded.
In buildings in which a sprinkler system has been installed in accordance with nfpa13d a fire alarm system need not be installed.
In buildings that contain fewer than 9 sprinklers conforming to es000736, a fire alarm system need not be installed.

A fire alarm system is not required in a residential occupancy where an exit or public corridor serves not more than 4 suites or where each suite has direct access to an exterior exit facility leading to ground level.

Except as stated in es016058 and as required by this Subsection, where fire alarm, fire detection and smoke detection devices and systems are installed, these devices and systems and their installation shall conform to ep001023.2.4
The following Articles in ep001023.2.4 regarding fire alarm systems do not apply to Part 9 buildings: Articles ea004486, ea004491, ea004492, ea000365, ea000366 and ea004498

National Article Title: Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke Detectors
National Sentence Text: Where a fire alarm system is required, every public corridor in buildings of residential occupancy and every exit stair shaft shall be provided with smoke detectors.

National Article Title: Rooms and Spaces Requiring Heat Detectors or Smoke Detectors
