National Article Title: Modeling Service Water Heating System of Reference House
National Sentence Text: Except as required by et001370, the performance of the service water heating equipment in the reference house shall be modeled as conforming to et001376 for the energy source, capacity and type of service water heating equipment in the proposed house.

This Subsection is concerned with determining the airtightness of buildings and dwelling units and parts thereof for use in the energy model calculations described in ep001029.37.5, or for use in determining the Airtightness Level for the purposes of es014643b, and determining the Airtightness Level for a building or dwelling unit to demonstrate compliance with ea003813

For the purposes of this Subsection, the following terms shall have the meanings stated herein: “zone” means a conditioned space or part thereof having a sufficiently large opening onto the location where the airtightness testing equipment is installed to provide enough airflow such that the entire zone is at the same pressure (see en001485), “attached zone” means a zone whose boundary area is fully or partially in contact with an adjacent zone or zones (see en001486), “ACH50” refers to the air changes per hour at a reference pressure of 50 Pa, “NLA10” refers to the normalized leakage area at a reference pressure of 10 Pa, and “NLR50” refers to the normalized leakage rate at a reference pressure of 50 Pa.

Where airtightness is to be used as input to the energy model calculations, it shall be determined through a multi-point depressurization test carried out in accordance with cgsb149.10 using the following parameters described therein: as-operated, and guarded or unguarded.

Except as provided in es014651, where airtightness is to be used to demonstrate compliance with an Airtightness Level listed in et000495or et000496, it shall be determined through a single-point, two-point or multi-point depressurization test carried out in accordance with cgsb149.10 using the following parameters described therein: as-operated, and guarded or unguarded, as applicable.
Determining NLA10 using a single-point test is not permitted.

Compliance with an Airtightness Level listed in et000495or et000496 shall be determined in accordance with this Article using the value of ACH50, NLA10, or NLR50 determined in accordance with es014646.

For the purposes of Sentences es014649and es014650, the Airtightness Level for buildings or dwelling units containing more than one zone shall be the lowest Airtightness Level achieved for the zones therein. (See en001484.)

Except as provided in Sentence es014650, the Airtightness Level for single zones and attached zones shall be determined by complying with one of the corresponding airtightness values stipulated in et000495.

Where the unguarded method is used to determine the airtightness of an attached zone, the Airtightness Level shall be determined by complying with one of the corresponding airtightness values stipulated in et000496, provided the zone is tested independently.

This Subsection is concerned with determining compliance with one of the energy performance tiers through modeling of the energy performance of components, systems and assemblies that are installed in buildings and houses with or without a secondary suite described in es006859.

For the purpose of this Subsection, the term “house” shall mean all houses, with or without a secondary suite, that have HVAC systems that serve only the house, only the secondary suite, or both the house and the secondary suite, have service water heating systems that serve only the house, only the secondary suite, or both the house and the secondary suite, and do not share common spaces intended for occupancy with other dwelling units or houses, except for a secondary suite.

The energy performance of buildings and houses, when calculated in accordance with ea003819, shall conform to the target energy performance based on the total volume of conditioned space within the building or house for the energy performance metrics indicated in et000505 such that the target “percent heat loss reduction” is met or exceeded, and one of the following conditions is satisfied (see en001489): the target “percent improvement” is met or exceeded, or the target “percent house energy target” is not exceeded.

Except where otherwise stated in this Article, the proposed and reference houses shall be modeled in accordance with ep001029.37.5 to determine the annual energy consumption of the proposed house and the house energy target of the reference house, the annual gross space heat loss of the proposed and reference houses calculated in accordance with Sentence es014692, and the peak cooling load of the proposed and reference houses (see Sentence es014691). (See en001490.)
The peak cooling load for the proposed house shall not be greater than the peak cooling load for the reference house. (See es014691.)

Except for energy performance tier 1, where space heating is provided by a heat pump in the proposed house, the reference house shall be modeled using equipment of the same type as the secondary or back-up system in the proposed house, but made to comply with the energy efficiency requirements of ea006210, or electric resistance heaters, where no back-up is provided in the proposed house.

Where cooling systems are not installed in the proposed house, both the proposed and reference houses shall have additional models using appropriately sized space-cooling equipment serving all conditioned spaces to determine the peak cooling load. (See en001491.)

The annual gross space heat loss shall be calculated as the sum of the cumulative heat loss from conduction across opaque and transparent elements of the building envelope, air infiltration and exfiltration, and mechanical ventilation. (See en001492.)

The percent heat loss reduction shall be calculated by subtracting the annual gross space heat loss of the proposed house from the annual gross space heat loss of the reference house and dividing the result by the annual gross space heat loss of the reference house.

The percent improvement shall be calculated by subtracting the annual energy consumption of the proposed house from the house energy target of the reference house and dividing the result by the house energy target of the reference house.
The percent house energy target shall be calculated by dividing the annual energy consumption of the proposed house by the house energy target of the reference house.

The airtightness value used in the energy model for the proposed house shall be the airtightness value set out in es008728a, or where an airtightness test is to be conducted, a design airtightness, until the airtightness has been measured in accordance with es014645 and the appropriate airtightness value set out in es008728 can be selected. (See en001493.)
This Subsection is concerned with the energy performance improvement of the building through the implementation of energy conservation measures.

Compliance with this Subsection shall be achieved by designing and constructing buildings to which this Subsection applies in accordance with one or more of the energy conservation measures prescribed in Articles ea003809to ea003815 to accumulate the minimum sum of energy conservation points required to attain Energy Performance Tier 2, 3, 4 or 5 as specified in et000497, and complying with Subsections ep001029.37.2to ep001029.37.4, except where these requirements are specifically permitted by this Subsection to be waived (see en001487).
Reserved
The building envelope shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles ea006189to ea006193 and this Subsection.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Above-Ground Opaque Building Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by Articles ea006193and ea006199, and es006895, the effective thermal resistance of above-ground opaque building assemblies or portions thereof shall be not less than that shown for the applicable heating degree-days of the building location in et001355.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Above-Ground Opaque Building Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Above-ground walls that comply with one of the energy conservation measures prescribed in et000498 shall be credited with the corresponding energy conservation points stipulated therein.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Above-Ground Opaque Building Assemblies
National Sentence Text: The effective thermal resistance of rim joists shall be not less than that of the above-ground walls.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Above-Ground Opaque Building Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Where the top of a section of foundation wall is on average greater than or equal to 600 mm above the adjoining ground level, the effective thermal resistance of the above-ground portion of that section of wall shall be not less than that of the above-ground walls.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Above-Ground Opaque Building Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Except for tubular daylighting devices, the effective thermal resistance of skylight shafts shall be not less than that of the above-ground walls.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Above-Ground Opaque Building Assemblies
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in es014663, where above-ground walls are constructed using two or more wall assemblies with different calculated effective thermal resistance values, the above-ground wall assembly with the lowest effective thermal resistance value shall be used to determine the applicable energy conservation points from et000498

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Above-Ground Opaque Building Assemblies
National Sentence Text: The effective thermal resistance of one or more of the above-ground wall assemblies referred to in es014662 is permitted to be less than that required to meet an energy conservation measure target listed in et000498 for the wall or walls to be credited with the energy conservation points listed for that target, provided the effective thermal resistance of one or more of the other above-ground wall assemblies is increased to more than the energy conservation measure target listed in et000498 to account for the wall assemblies that do not meet the target, and the sum of the results of each individual above-ground wall assembly area divided by its respective effective thermal resistance is less than or equal to the total area of all above-ground wall assemblies divided by the effective thermal resistance target listed in et000498 that is to be credited. (See also en001794.)

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Fenestration and Doors
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es014665to es014667, fenestration and doors that comply with one of the energy conservation measures prescribed in et000499 shall be credited with the corresponding energy conservation points stipulated therein, provided all fenestration and doors comply with that energy conservation measure.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Fenestration and Doors
National Sentence Text: Where the individual doors or windows have more than one overall thermal transmittance value (U-value), an average U-value is permitted to be used to determine the applicable energy conservation points from et000499, provided the requirements of es014666 are met.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Fenestration and Doors
National Sentence Text: The U-value of one or more doors or fenestration is permitted to be greater than that required in et000499, provided the traded doors and fenestration are located in the same orientation, the U-value of one or more of the other doors and fenestration is decreased to less than the energy conservation measure target in et000499 to account for the doors and windows that do not meet the target, and the sum of each individual door or fenestration area multiplied by its respective U-value is less than or equal to the total area of all fenestration and doors multiplied by the U-value target in et000499 that is to be credited. (See also en001795.)

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Fenestration and Doors
National Sentence Text: Where the fenestration and doors make up not more than 17% of the total above-ground wall area, including openings, in a given orientation, the fenestration and doors in that orientation need not comply with Sentence es014664 and are not subject to the provisions of Sentences es014665and es014666, provided they meet or exceed the minimum Energy Rating stated in et000499 that is to be credited. (See en001488.)

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Opaque Building Assemblies Below-Grade or in Contact with the Ground
National Sentence Text: Opaque building assemblies below-grade or in contact with the ground shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Sentences es008892to es006909 and this Article.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Opaque Building Assemblies Below-Grade or in Contact with the Ground
National Sentence Text: Except as permitted by ea006193, the effective thermal resistance of foundation walls shall be not less than that shown for the applicable heating degree-days of the building location in et001359.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Opaque Building Assemblies Below-Grade or in Contact with the Ground
National Sentence Text: Foundation walls that comply with one of the energy conservation measures prescribed in et000500 shall be credited with the corresponding energy conservation points stipulated therein.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Opaque Building Assemblies Below-Grade or in Contact with the Ground
National Sentence Text: Where foundation walls are constructed with more than one effective thermal resistance (RSI) value, the lowest effective RSI value of any of these walls shall be used to determine the applicable energy conservation points from et000500

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures Relating to Airtightness
National Sentence Text: Buildings to which this Subsection applies shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles ea006197and ea006198, or ea006197and Sentences es006915to es014642 and shall, where airtightness testing is carried out in accordance with ep001029.37.6, comply with an Airtightness Level listed in et000495or et000496.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures Relating to Airtightness
National Sentence Text: Buildings that comply with an Airtightness Level determined in accordance with Clause es014672b shall be credited with the corresponding energy conservation points stipulated in et000501

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for HVAC Systems
National Sentence Text: HVAC systems, equipment and installations shall be designed and constructed in accordance with Articles ea006202to ea006208 and this Article.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for HVAC Systems
National Sentence Text: Where HVAC systems, equipment or techniques other than those described in Articles ea006202to ea006208 and this Article are used, the building shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the nrcc-necb.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for HVAC Systems
National Sentence Text: Ventilation systems serving buildings to which this Subsection applies shall be equipped with a heat-recovery ventilator conforming to ea006209

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for HVAC Systems
National Sentence Text: Heat-recovery ventilators that comply with one of the energy conservation measures prescribed in et000502 shall be credited with the corresponding energy conservation points stipulated therein.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Service Water Heating Equipment
National Sentence Text: Service water heating equipment and components shall be designed and constructed in accordance with ep001029.37.4 and this Article.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Service Water Heating Equipment
National Sentence Text: Where service water heating equipment or techniques other than those described in ep001029.37.4 and this Article are used, the building shall be designed and constructed in accordance with the nrcc-necb.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Measures for Service Water Heating Equipment
National Sentence Text: Service water heating equipment that complies with one of the energy conservation measures prescribed in et000503 shall be credited with the corresponding energy conservation points stipulated therein.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Points for Building Volume
National Sentence Text: Buildings to which this Subsection applies that contain more than one dwelling unit, each of which contains not more than 230 m3 of conditioned space measured at the interior surfaces of the walls, ceilings and floors enclosing the suite, are permitted to be credited with ten energy conservation points.

National Article Title: Energy Conservation Points for Building Volume
National Sentence Text: Buildings to which this Subsection applies that contain not more than 390 m3 of conditioned space, measured at the interior surfaces of exterior walls, ceilings and floors, are permitted to be credited with energy conservation points determined in accordance with et000504

For the purpose of compliance with this Code as required in es007221b, the objectives and functional statements attributed to the acceptable solutions in this Part shall be the objectives and functional statements listed in et001105 (See en001281.)
This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code. (See ea004131.)

Words and phrases used in Division C that are not included in the list of definitions in ea004484 shall have the meanings that are commonly assigned to them in the context in which they are used, taking into account the specialized use of terms by the various trades and professions to which the terminology applies.
Where objectives and functional statements are referred to in Division C, they shall be the objectives and functional statements described in Parts 2 and 3 of Division A.
Where acceptable solutions are referred to in Division C, they shall be the provisions stated in Parts 2 to 9 of Division B.
Where alternative solutions are referred to in Division C, they shall be the alternative solutions mentioned in es007221b.
The words and terms in italics in Division C shall have the meanings assigned to them in ea004484.
The symbols and other abbreviations in Division C shall have the meanings assigned to them in ea004447.
This Part applies to all buildings covered in this Code. (See ea004131.)

This Code shall be administered in conformance with the appropriate provincial or territorial regulations, municipal bylaws or, in the absence of such regulations or bylaws, in conformance with the Administrative Requirements for Use with the National Building Code of Canada 1985.
For design carried out in accordance with Part 4 of Division B, the designer shall be a professional engineer or architect skilled in the work concerned. (See en001282.)
Sufficient information shall be provided to show that the proposed work will conform to this Code and whether or not it may affect adjacent property.

Plans shall be drawn to scale and shall indicate the nature and extent of the work or proposed occupancy in sufficient detail to establish that, when completed, the work and the proposed occupancy will conform to this Code.
When proposed work is changed during construction, information on the changes shall comply with the requirements of this Section for proposed work.
Site plans shall be referenced to an up-to-date survey and, when required to prove compliance with this Code, a copy of the survey shall be provided.

Site plans shall show by dimensions from property lines, the location of the proposed building, the similarly dimensioned location of every adjacent existing building on the property, existing and finished ground levels to an established datum at or adjacent to the site, and the access routes for firefighting.

National Article Title: Information Required for Fire Protection Components
National Sentence Text: Information shall be submitted to show the major components of fire protection including the division of the building by firewalls, the building area, the degree of fire separation of storeys, shafts and special rooms or areas, including the location and rating of closures in fire separations, the source of information for fire-resistance ratings of elements of construction (to be indicated on large-scale sections), the source of information for encapsulation ratings of mass timber elements of construction (to be indicated on large-scale sections), the location of exits, and fire detection, suppression and alarm systems.

Before a sprinkler system is installed or altered, plans showing full details of the proposed sprinkler system and essential details of the building in which it is to be installed shall be drawn to an indicated scale.
This Subsection applies only to buildings covered in Part 4 of Division B. (See ea004138.)

National Article Title: Professional Seal and Signature of Designer
National Sentence Text: Structural drawings and related documents submitted with the application to build shall be dated and shall bear the authorized professional seal and signature of the designer as defined in es008651.

Structural drawings and related documents submitted with the application to build shall indicate, in addition to those items specified in ea000126 and in Part 4 of Division B applicable to the specific material, the name and address of the person responsible for the structural design, the date of issue of the Code and standards to which the design conforms, the dimensions, location and size of all structural members in sufficient detail to enable the design to be checked, sufficient detail to enable the dead loads to be determined, all effects and loads, other than dead loads, used for the design of the structural members and exterior cladding, and the Importance Category of the building.

Structural drawings of parts or components including guards designed by a person other than the designer of the building shall be dated and shall bear the authorized professional seal and signature of the designer of such parts or components.
The calculations and analysis made in the design of the structural members, including parts and components, of a building shall be available for inspection upon request.

Foundation drawings submitted with the application to build or excavate shall be provided to indicate the type and condition of the soil or rock, as well as the groundwater conditions, as determined by the subsurface investigation, the factored bearing pressures on the soil or rock, the factored loads when applicable and the design loads applied to foundation units, and the earth pressures and other loads applied to the supporting structures of supported excavations.
When required, evidence that justifies the information on the drawings shall be submitted with the application to excavate or build.

Where conditions as described under Sentences es001519 and es001520 are encountered, or where foundation units or their locations are altered, this information shall be recorded on appropriate drawings or new “as constructed” drawings.
This Subsection applies to building materials, components and assemblies to which Part 5 of Division B applies. (See ea004138.)

National Article Title: Information Required on Drawings and Specifications
National Sentence Text: Information shown on drawings and in specifications shall be clear and legible, and shall contain sufficient details to demonstrate conformance with this Code. (See en000014.)
This Subsection applies only to buildings covered in ep001026. (See ea004138.)

The information shown on architectural drawings and on drawings for heating, ventilating and air-conditioning systems shall be clear and legible and shall contain all necessary details to demonstrate conformance with this Code. (See en000014.)
This Subsection applies only to buildings covered in Part 4 of Division B (see ea004138), except that Articles ea000142 and ea003559 apply to all buildings covered in this Code. (See ea004131.)
The designer or another suitably qualified person shall review the construction of any building or part thereof to determine conformance with the design.
The designer or another suitably qualified person shall review all shop drawings and other related documents relevant to the design to determine conformance with the design.
Workmanship, materials and all reports of material tests shall be reviewed by the designer or another suitably qualified person during the process of construction.

Where a building or component of a building is assembled off the building site in such a manner that it cannot be reviewed on site, off-site reviews shall be provided to determine compliance with this Code.

When reviewing construction dimensions related to commonly available building components and materials, the designer or another suitably qualified person shall consider that the prescriptive metric values in the Code may have been converted and rounded from imperial values.

This Subsection applies only to houses with or without a secondary suite and to buildings containing only dwelling units and common spaces whose total floor area does not exceed 20% of the total floor area of the building that are modeled in accordance with ep001029.37.5 to demonstrate compliance with the energy efficiency objectives of Subsections ep001029.37.2 to ep001029.37.4. (See en001781.) (See also es006862 and en001731.)

National Article Title: Information Required on Drawings and Specifications
National Sentence Text: Except as provided in Sentences es008784 to es008786, the drawings and specifications for the proposed house shall include the effective thermal resistance values and respective areas of all opaque building envelope assemblies, including all above-ground and below-ground roof/ceiling, wall, and floor assemblies, the overall thermal transmittance (U-value), solar heat gain coefficient and respective areas of all fenestration and door components, the ratio of total vertical fenestration and door area to gross wall area, the performance rating, energy source, and types of all equipment required for space-heating and -cooling and service water heating, the design basis for the ventilation rates, where a test is used to determine the airtightness of a house, the measured airtightness of the building envelope in air changes per hour, and any additional features used in the energy model calculations that account for a significant difference in house energy performance.

National Article Title: Information Required on Drawings and Specifications
National Sentence Text: The effective thermal resistance values and respective areas of opaque building envelope assemblies that cover less than 2% of the total area of their respective assembly type need not be provided in the drawings and specifications required in es008783.

National Article Title: Information Required on Drawings and Specifications
National Sentence Text: Where part-load characteristics are used in the modeling of the HVAC equipment, they need not be provided in the drawings and specifications required in es008783.

National Article Title: Information Required on Drawings and Specifications
National Sentence Text: The features of the proposed house that differ from those of the reference house shall be detailed in the specifications required in es008783.
A house performance compliance calculation report shall be provided in accordance with es008788 for each proposed house design.

In addition to the drawings and specifications required in ea006234, the house performance compliance calculation report shall include a project information section containing the name or identifier of the project, a description of the project, the address of the project, the name and version of the calculation tool, the geographic region in which the proposed house is to be built, and the identifier for the climatic data set used for analysis, a summary of the characteristics of the building envelope, HVAC system and service water heating system reflecting the information provided in ea006234, an energy performance data summary containing the annual energy consumption of all energy sources calculated for the proposed house (see en001782), and the house energy target of all energy sources calculated for the reference house, where a software program is used to determine compliance, the name of the software program(s), and a list of any adaptations made by the user to the software relating to input or output values, and a statement that the calculation was performed in compliance with ep001029.37.5.

Documentation conforming to this Subsection shall be provided by the person requesting the use of an alternative solution to demonstrate that the proposed alternative solution complies with this Code.

The documentation referred to in es007283 shall include a Code analysis outlining the analytical methods and rationales used to determine that a proposed alternative solution will achieve at least the level of performance required by es007221b, and information concerning any special maintenance or operational requirements, including any building component commissioning requirements, that are necessary for the alternative solution to achieve compliance with the Code after the building is constructed.

The Code analysis referred to in es008658a shall identify the applicable objectives, functional statements and acceptable solutions, and any assumptions, limiting or restricting factors, testing procedures, engineering studies or building performance parameters that will support a Code compliance assessment.
The Code analysis referred to in es008658a shall include information about the qualifications, experience and background of the person or persons taking responsibility for the design.
The information provided under es008659 shall be in sufficient detail to convey the design intent and to support the validity, accuracy, relevance and precision of the Code analysis.

Where the design of a building includes proposed alternative solutions that involve more than one person taking responsibility for different aspects of the design, the applicant for the permit shall identify a single person to co-ordinate the preparation of the design, Code analysis and documentation referred to in this Subsection.
